Reviews.Title: Impressive
Reviews.Author: Jim Chou
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a secondary monitor to use with my HTPC to use at the breakfast table when I didn't want to turn on the big plasma, and thought this might be interesting because it's LED backlit (edgelit really) and had Netflix and some other widgets.It turns out to be really cool... good picture quality - not as much contrast ratio as a much pricier, larger TV obviously, but decent for casual TV watching, good colors and viewing angles. The Netflix support works really well, streamed HD over the wireless without any issues, apparently the same quality as my Roku HD box - that alone is worth buying it for.Some of the widgets are pretty useless (I'm looking at you, CBS), they're basically just ad channels, and I haven't found news that's more than two lines long. It would be nice if there were a web browser for it, or a dedicated NY Times app.The sound quality isn't bad for a TV... you'd get better sound adding some cheap computer speakers with a subwoofer, but I don't really blame the TV, it's so skinny there's not really room for decent speakers.All in all, quite a nice toy, great for a dorm or kitchen.

Reviews.Title: Internet apps are a game changer.
Reviews.Author: P. Chittiboina
Reviews.Content: I wanted a monitor for home office to connect to my Macbook Pro. Looked at monitors, and settled on the Vizio instead. This is an early review (bought it yesterday).The unit is very light and is easy to assmble (no tools required other than opposable thumbs). Connected to the network via LAN cable to Airport Extreme. The unit detected internet with no problems. The internet apps were available right out of the set-up process including some of my favorites like Pandora and Netflix.The internet apps allow me to watch videos off Netflix and listen to music without turning on the computer at all. I haven't used the unit as a monitor yet. Will update the review when the cables arrive.Pro: Light, good picture quality, direct internet connectivity.Cons: Painful to enter information from the remote, slight lag in moving between apps.Updates to follow.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: John Bacon
Reviews.Content: We have only had this TV for a week but we love this TV.  It replaced an old TV in a bedroom that required a digital converter box.  We hooked it up to a rabbit ears antenna, and followed the easy on-screen instructions to connect it to our wireless home network.  We live in a metro area and with only the rabbit ears, we get a terrific picture.  Besides the picture, one thing we especially appreciate is the automatic sound level control feature that probably all Vizio televisions come with.  It stops commercials from blasting us.  We haven't used the Web apps yet, but we would already recommend this TV to anyone for a bedroom or office.

Reviews.Title: Snappy little TV with great web-apps
Reviews.Author: KyleB "coyote-65"
Reviews.Content: I'd found this TV in the clearance aisle of a chain store for a bit less than the price here, but in the end I would have been happy to pay Amazon's full price.The unit works great overall, the web apps are zippy (after update), the picture quality is fantastic for the price paid, the wireless connected without issues, and short of the remote being a little clunky it's a great buy for the price as a second tv for the kids, a second monitor on the desk, or even as a 'move around' set.Interesting bits:1. Wireless:  Worked great out-of-the-box. Took maybe a minute for it to connect to my home network, and so far the single strength's been great up to 35' and through at least one wall.  I would feel confident that my 65yo Mom could connect this TV wired or wirelessly.2. Self Update: The tv updated its firmware over the wireless within an hour of being turned on.  The newer firmware did wonders for the web apps as far as speed, app choices, and interfaces for Netflix and Amazon On-demand.3. Video web apps:  Netflix, Amazon On-Demand, Hulu Plus, Pandora, and a couple others are all great.  Picture quality can vary from the supplier, but of the few tests run so far the picture quality of Amazon on-demand, Hulu Plus, and the majority of the netflix videos we looked at were HD quality or nearly indistinguishable from HD.  There's some buffering/blocking at the start of Netflix videos, but disappears after 10-30sec.  Watched a few minutes of Battlestar Galactica HD from Amazon On-Demand and it definitely passed our in-house HD-or-not test with flying colors ('Look good to you?' - 'Yup, looks good to me').  Two thumbs up for AOD.4. Other web-apps:  Meh.  The web apps consist mostly of Yahoo Widget devices, and at this stage I would describe them as basic.  The Facebook app reminds me of my blackberry interface.  This TV does NOT utilize a browser interface, only widget/app interfaces. There are a few game apps, but I haven't tried them yet.  The game selections seem basic, texas holdem, spider solitaire, a few young kids games, nothing too fancy.5. No YouTube app, but there is a Yahoo Videos app.  Not explored.6. Speakers:  3 watt tiny, tin-can'ish speakers.  There is a headphone and optical output on the back of this machine, so there are options w/external speakers, but do not expect much other than getting the job done out of the internal speakers.  For the non-discerning they're fine, but anyone planning to get their rock on need to supply their own.  For me they work great, the kids don't care and they get the job done if I'm using it as a second monitor.7. HDMI connectors - 2 supplied and work great for connecting the PS3 with as few cables as possible.8. Remote:  Kinda clunky, kinda cheap feeling.  I'm a little worried about dropping it from counter height onto a hard surface..  Also, there are limited controls on the TV, everything is manipulated from the remote.  Unfortunately, any text entry is done from a selection grid on screen, moving the cursor, clicking 'ok' on the remote, moving the cursor again, clicking 'ok' on the remote again..  Not so bad a task, but the way the included remote is designed the 'ok' key is buried in the middle of the arrow keys sometimes causing more than one 'ok' entry (which then forces you to arrow-key down to the on-screen delete key and then another 'ok' button-cick.. this remote should have been designed with separate delete & enter keys..)  I'm considering replacing the remote with a universal learning one and putting the oem up for safe-keeping.9. Portability:  Given the built-in wifi, there's really only the power cable to carry with the TV as .long as you're watching online video.10. Connections/Video quality: 2HDMI, 1 Component, 1 Antenna/Cable Connection, 1 composite, 1 RGB.  So far I've tested the HDMI only, connected to an AMD video card and a PS3.  The 1080p is fantastic from both sources, and after fiddling a bit with the TV's video color/brightness settings I'm very pleased with the quality of color and clarity for both monitor and gaming use. I haven't noticed ghosting from either computer games or the PS3.For it's price the unit packs some good bang for the buck - Portable, easy setup/use, better than expected image quality, wifi out-of-the-box, and web-apps (Netflix or Amazon On-Demand alone would have made this an ideal purchase) - with the caveats being the kinda klunky remote and the tin can sounding speakers.  Overall a great second TV or a TV for the Xbox/PS3 kid in the house, or as a second monitor/entertainment device on your desk.

Reviews.Title: Great product!
Reviews.Author: jadelung
Reviews.Content: I have been looking for a small TV for my bedroom and did a lot of shopping around. This TV is amazing.The best thing about this TV is the built-in Wifi. You don't need to purchase anything extra to get the Wifi to work. For example my Tivo unit you have to buy an antenna, which is not cheap. The internet apps are amazing!I love the Web Videos App you can watch on-demand material from CBS, FOX, WB, PBS, and more! It's like Hulu!It has a Vudu app. A VUDU Set Top Box on Amazon cost $199.99! I just paid $238.00 on Amazon for a TV that has Vudo, Netflix, Amazon On-Demand and more.This TV saves you money you don't need to buy a Roku, VUDU, or Boxee! All you need is this great TV!Pros: Great picture, built-in Wifi!, great apps, thin and light, easy to use,.Cons: No slide-out keyboard remote, remote does not light up in dark, sound is okay, but not great.I give this TV a 4.5 out of 5. If the sound was a little bit better it would be a 5. It would be nice if you had the option to purchase the slide-out remote separately.

Reviews.Title: Okay, for it's price.
Reviews.Author: Mark Friesen
Reviews.Content: This is my first foray into Vizio, and likely my last. The set works well enough, but there are better options out there. In the last year I have replaced all of out TV with Samsung LCDs. 5 in total. Recently my wife asked for a new TV in her sewing room. I figured I'd branch out and try a Vizio unit. While Vizio has sizable market share I can only imagine that it's based on price, not quality. I'll be specific:Weak points- Sound is very tinny and hollow sounding. Allowances must be made for such a small set, but a only slightly larger set in our kitchen sounds worlds better.- The remote is laughably cheap looking/feeling. Not only are the materials cheap, but the button layout is awkward. The four way rocker with select is difficult to use.- If you look closely at the picture of the front of the set you may see printing in the lower left area of the bezel. In person it is really obnoxious. I like the fact that it has all these features, but I don't need to have it plastered on the front of the device. Vizio must be trying to appeal to a NASCAR crowd.- The picture is fairly washed out. No matter the settings the picture looks more washed out and grey than any of our other sets.Good points:- Wifi set was painless. I wasn't even going to use the wireless capabilities, but it found our network instantly locked on.- Netflix app is a nice feature. Selection is fairly weak, but it's a nice bonus.Conclusion:For an extra $50 I'll be going back to Samsung for our next TV. This one isn't so bad, but there are others that are much better.

Reviews.Title: More than expected
Reviews.Author: OlsonBros
Reviews.Content: WOW - Native 1080P really makes a difference. The picture quality is unbelievable compared to the 720P I replaced. The apps all work good and there was no problem configuring the Wireless N. This TV is over the top in all aspects except sound quality. Sound quality is disappointing at best.After doing some research and trying different multimedia speakers as a solution I ended up with the USB powered Altec Lansing BXR1220 2.0 Speaker System from Amazon. Perfect. This compact set of USB powered speakers plug into the headphone out and preform excellent. They even power down with the TV when using the VIZIO built-in USB port for power. Sound output is noticeably louder, clearer, more dynamic and has more bass than the built-in speakers. I HIGHLY recommend getting these Multimedia speakers from Amazon at Amazon's usual bargain price ($18.15 as of this writing) as TV sound solution.

Reviews.Title: the best TV deal on the internet!
Reviews.Author: BrianM
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before I purchased this TV, and it was worth every minute.  Priced similar to lower definition smaller sets, this not only boasts full 1080p resolution, 22" size, a wide variety of inputs, and a HUGE contrast ratio, but it features smart tv options such as internet applications and wi-fi capability as well.Several reviews complained of poor sound quality from the speakers, however; a quick adjustment of the sound e.q. sliders in the options and I could tune the sound to my own desires, now it sounds better than the set it is replacing by a mile!I paid $189.99 for a refurbished set, and the only refurbishing I could detect was that the remote control seemed like it had maybe been used very briefly, the set itsself had all of the original scratch protection plastic on the case and base stand of the TV, all the cables, etc. were packaged and wrapped exactly as the factory would, and the TV was actually even in the original box!  Don't fear saving money!  Refurbished TVs almost always had nothing wrong with them (I have done warranty repairs, only about 6% of the returned products actually have any defects, most often they are returned because the consumer doesn't understand how to operate it correctly...)Clearly, between the pricing, size, quality picture, and excellent internet capabilities, this is either the best TV deal on the internet, or it's darned close!!!

Reviews.Title: Sub par quality product and disappointing Technical support
Reviews.Author: D. Rao "dRao"
Reviews.Content: I am an avid buyer from Amazon. Amazon always deserves 5 stars. All the products have been great and no complaints, except my purchase of Vizio M221NV TV.I bought this TV on March 2011. Every now and then, the wireless internet connection would disconnect and I had to  redo the setup.  After about 10 months, the wireless internet connection completely failed.  Finally when I had just a few days left for the warranty to expire, I called the Vizio customer support. After holding for a long time and bearing with all the instructions of the tech support, I was asked to upload the Proof of Purchase. After uploading the proof of purchase, I was given a case number and told that I will be contacted by the Tech support in 2 business days. However, even after 5 days, no response. Finally I called back Vizio tech support. After holding for a long time, I was transferred to Level 1 support. After reviewing the case number, I was transferred to Level2 tech support. In the middle of the call, I was disconnected. Again I called back. Reached Level 1 tech support and then Level 2 tech support. Finally the Level 2 support agreed that the TV is at fault and asked me to send the TV to the the service center at CA at  my own cost. This means the shipping cost will be around $70 to$ 80 which I have to bear from my own pocket and wait for 2 to 3 weeks. Vizio Tech support is very disappointing. Beware when you buy from Vizio.According to Vizio service, for TV's smaller than 30 inches, defective TV needs to be shipped at our own expense. I wish I could have given zero stars to Vizio TV and its tech support.

Reviews.Title: Set Up is Excruciating - Wifi A No Go Without Firmware Update
Reviews.Author: L.Gildart
Reviews.Content: Update:  Many, many thanks to the commenter who told me about the firmware update.  I took the tv into the living room, hooked up an ethernet cable, applied the firmware update, and was able to connect wirelessly.  Except for Netflix and TedTV, I don't think my son will get much use from the internet apps, but it was nice to get them up and running.I bought this tv because of the internet applications, but after repeated tries, during which the tv found my network, I painstakingly entered my password, and the tv failed to connect, I was not able to to connect wirelessly and try them out.  The tv is too small for the room in which my router and modem live, so connecting with a cable is not an option.  Since the whole point of the purchase was to enable my son to watch Netflix and similar content in his room without my having to worry about him clicking on an inappropriate or virus-enabling link, that purpose has been soundly defeated by the device's inability to connect to my recent model airport extreme base station.  As noted above, a firmware update solved the connectivity issues, so, if you're thinking about buying this, you may want to set it up next to your cable modem / router, and then move it to the room in which you want it.The sound quality leaves much to be desired.  When I was setting it up with my cable box, I had another tv on in the room - an old Samsung 17 inch lcd - that sounded noticeably clearer.That's the bad.  The good is that the picture quality is excellent.  The form factor is lovely.  It leaves a lot more room than its predecessor did on my son's desk.  Other than the network issues, set up was time-consuming but easy.  It also hooked up to my dvi port on my computer via a dvi to hdmi cable with great results.

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware
Reviews.Author: mway
Reviews.Content: The picture is great, the sound is dismal and the quality is non-existent.  I purchased this HDTV in July 2011.  By November 2011 the tuner started dropping channels one at a time until I only have a dark, blank display.  Technical Service was great but the solution is terrible: although covered by the warranty any TV less than 30 inches needs to be sent by the buyer to the west coast (at your own expense) for repair.  What a terrible consumer policy!  First, you better have room to store your empty cartons until the warranty expires; then pack and send, at no minor cost, for repair and then wait.  Second, VIZIO has a corporate shipping account that costs them a fraction of what it will cost the consumer yet they refuse to issue a prepaid shipping label stating that is more cost effiecient (for them) to have the consumer burden the cost.  This is not stated in the warranty documentation so I beleive that this is a deceptive practice.  Had I known this was the policy I would have never purchased this product. Good luck.  This was my first, and my LAST Vizio purchase.

Reviews.Title: Surprisingly Horrible!
Reviews.Author: Autumn
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews on this Vizio I expected a quality product...what I got was terrible! The internal interface would NOT CONNECT to my Wi-Fi and the picture quality was muddy. Angled viewing was distorted and the remote required excess pressure to operate...A lemon or just a poor quality TV?

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Picture...Internet Connectivity...What Else Do You Want?
Reviews.Author: T. Vuong
Reviews.Content: We have this as our kitchen/bar TV and it works out perfectly.  This is hooked up to an indoor antenna and it gets decent reception.  We also have it connected to our wifi router for streaming Netflix and Pandora.Picture: Beautiful.  1080P is really nice.  This is our first LED TV and the contrast is awesome.  No complaints here.Connectivity: Had some issues with it connecting to the internet.  The WIFI router appeared, but we couldn't connect to it.  After 3-4 calls to technical support, we were able to reset the connection by renaming the SSID (I chose a new name without a comma).  Not sure the actual reason, but it connected finally.  Vizio tech support was really quick to pick up (no runaround voice prompts and button pushing).  I was impressed with the support both online and on the phone.Netflix: Works great and the UI is almost as good as Xbox 360 as it allows you to search and browse available movies/TV shows.  Streaming takes a bit to load, but once it's up the stream is seamless.Pandora: We were planning for this to replace our Sony iPhone dock to listen to Pandora.  Unfortunately, there are some bugs with it.  Streams take forever to load and if you do anything to it, like skip or back up, Pandora freezes up.  We have not been able to use this for Pandora reliably.Hulu Plus: Streaming is perfect. Interface is a bit sluggish, but it's nice to see movie info while movie is running in a PIP window.  Overall, nice presentation.Other Apps (Yahoo Widgets): Tried the Weather App and the TV Guide App...both were useful.Reception: The ATSC tuner is not as sensitive as our previous TV (Sceptre X23BV-Naga).  Channels that we were able to get before no longer are available.  So overall, good...not great reception.Audio: I've read the issues with the speakers, but really it's better than the Sceptre we previously had.  Not great, but passable.  Music does sound a bit tinny, but dialog is fine.  Audio Settings were almost non-existent which doesn't help.Mounting: Not VESA compliant and connections are perpendicular to the TV so it's only meant to be a desktop/bartop device.  Not an issue for us, but just be aware of this if you need it mounted.FINAL VERDICT: Highly recommended.  Once the internet issues were solved, TV works perfectly as expected.  For the price and features, you can't beat it.  No Roku or Apple TV necessary.  If you can get pass the audio and no mounting issues, it's the perfect kitchen/office TV.UPDATE 2/28: I just saw in the manual that you can mount this thing with a wall mount bracket that attaches to the back of the unit.  I don't remember seeing this included in the package I received so it may be optional.

Reviews.Title: Great out of the box, and then....
Reviews.Author: Christopher Martin "Tech junkie"
Reviews.Content: I bought the first of these TVs at Target because the price was great and the features were impressive. At first, it all seemed wonderful with a great picture and wireless connection to the internet.  Then about 3 weeks after I bought it, the TV just started powering up by itself at random times like in the middle of the night while we were sleeping or while we were away at work.  Who knows how long it was running then?  Another big problem was that the wireless internet only works intermittently. I set the TV up inside the same room as my wireless N router, and signal strength is not a problem. The initial setup worked fine and it recognized my router and everything. Then later, it simply couldn't see any routers and refused to find the internet connection.  Great concept, poor engineering.I would have just written these things off as a problem with one TV, but I returned the first TV to Target and accepted another of the same model in exchange.  Guess what?  The second TV did the exact same things as the first one.  I hope it's just a bad lot of TVs from Visio that went to that Target.  Unfortunately, I can't take the chance, and I'm returning the second one before I'm stuck with it.Beware the great feature list! The TV has to work in the long run, and no one loves being woken up in the middle of the night by a blaring TV that makes you think you have ghosts in your house!

Reviews.Title: Great price,great apps
Reviews.Author: John W. Anthony "LA Tech"
Reviews.Content: Picked this set up and so far it's great.Great selection of apps. Netflix,pandora,vudu,Twitter,Facebook,amazon movie rentals etc. All work great over the built in wireless N.Only cons of the tv are the built in speakers,there pretty terrible. The remote gets the job done but wish it was back lit, hard to operate in the dark.For the price ,selection of apps and picture quality the tv is a keeper for me.

Reviews.Title: Unstable
Reviews.Author: LT in California
Reviews.Content: I purchased this about 1 year ago.  Let me get straight to the point:Likes:- VIA Apps and internet TV- Small, I used this mainly to watch TV while exercisingDislikes:- VIA Apps, overall slow to load, Hulu extremely slow at loading.- Remote does not work most of the time after about half a year, frustrating.- TV turns off by itself from time to time.  When this happens, sometimes, it would take me more than a minute before the TV turns back on again.Overall, a very frustrating experience because TV turns off by itself intermittently and remote stops working after a while.

Reviews.Title: Nice!!
Reviews.Author: JP "JP"
Reviews.Content: We bought this for my son's bedroom.  He likes to watch TV shows from netflix on-demand and this works perfectly.  His room is in the back of the house and it streams from the router with no delay or problems.  The picture is nice and clear with deep color and resolution.  The sound quality is average and not disappointing.  The TV is not heavy and it is a perfect size for an average bedroom.  The only problem I see is that there are no parental controls on the TV itself but other than that the TV exceeded expectations and my son is thrilled.

Reviews.Title: Great but remote is a little cheap
Reviews.Author: D. Squires
Reviews.Content: Great TV, web apps work.  Lots of fun to use.  The only issue I have is the remote is a little cheap.  Also entering data into the web apps takes time with the remote.  Wish you could buy and use the Vizio remotes sold with their higher end TV's.  Other then the remote it's a great TV.  Got mine at Sams for $199 on black Friday.  The price at Sams now is $129.

Reviews.Title: Very poor quality
Reviews.Author: Thumbmaster
Reviews.Content: We bought this last year based on the decent specs and the low price. The moment I unpacked this I knew it was trouble. The remote's buttons feel like some Fisher-Price toys. The TV's viewing angle is nowhere near the specs of 170°+. If you move a couple of feet off center (45° or so), you start to get major color shifts and it's basically unwatchable. Vertically, it has a threshold of maybe 10-20° before it becomes unwatchable. This TV forces you to watch it straight on. Otherwise, the picture quality is on par with what you'd expect on a TV in this price range. The sound quality is about as good (or bad) as a $15 drugstore radio. It sounds like a next door neighbor's TV on full blast. None of the adjustments make it any better. Built-in WiFi is easy to setup and connection is quite reliable. The VIA apps work as advertised but the interface responds very slowly. Did I mention the crappy remote? Every button push makes you feel like it's going to break. If you push the buttons gently, they don't respond. For the 2 weeks we kept the TV, I resorted to using our universal remote instead. We returned this and bought a larger LG instead. It costs a little more but it's MILES better in overall quality and experience. Before you buy, look at it at a local electronics store to make sure you can live with its shortcomings.

Reviews.Title: Great TV excellent choice
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: This set is an excellet TV for a kitchen or bedroom setting.Picture is great.Setup is easy.Price is good.Only one minor complaint. After about 2 weeks, my wife mentioned that the sound was a bit 'tinny'; the speakers are small. I purchased a pair of low cost amplified speakers for about $10. They hide behind the set and everyone is happy.I suggest speakers that are powered by a USB plug but still have a mini jack for sound. The digital speakers that try to take the audio signal from the USB port will not function.Other than the Audio I give it 5 stars.It even comes with a simple Wall mount included in package.

Reviews.Title: No HDMI CEC
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Contrary to the Vizio website and the actual user manual, this TV is not HDMI-CEC-compliant. There is no menu item for CEC though it's shown in the manual. I spent an hour online with Vizio support before I was able to speak with a second rep who confirmed with engineering that that function was removed and may or may not be enabled in future firmware.

Reviews.Title: Problem with TV randomly turning off
Reviews.Author: Lup01
Reviews.Content: This TV has a good picture and although the sound is not very good it is easy enough to connect a set of speakers in order to get good sound.The problem I am having with the TV is that it randomly turns itself off and then it takes a few minutes before it will turn back on. I searched online and found that others were having this problem with some of the internet ready Vizio TVs. I checked with Vizio and they ran me through a couple of actions that did not solve the problem. They finally told me I could return the TV and they would repair it, but that means I could be up to two weeks without a TV. I asked if they would just replace the TV and they were unwilling to do that. I will certainly be more cautious about buying a Vizio product in the future given this interaction with their support people.

Reviews.Title: Good TV - AWFUL, AWFUL remote
Reviews.Author: Wile E Wonka
Reviews.Content: I have owned this TV for a year.  This is a good TV, BUT the remote is the worst thought out piece of annoyance I have ever used (as far as remotes go).The enter button is so small that it is difficult to activate it without hitting one of the arrow buttons.  When using the Netflix search function it is extremely tedious and frustrating.  When trying to spell out the movie title, being searched for, entering multiples of the same letter occurs ofter, requiring a trip to the delete button to correct it  (hopefully not over-correcting).  The other problem with the enter/arrows control is hitting the arrow, instead of enter, thus skipping one or two letters ahead/back/up or down.  The other ulcerating factor are the video play controls.  These are located on the top of the remote (which in itself is not too bad) BUT, they are all the same size and smallish, often requiring me to look at the buttons, in order to pause/restart or FF & REW (challenging to do in the dim light).  They should have, at least, made them different shapes OR with spaces, separating them from one another.  The TV picture is good, for a LCD TV.  I would have given it 4 stars, except for the blasted remote (and 2 stars if anything else were bad).  Visio, apparently, didn't do their ergonomic homework.  I never thought to consider the remote, before I bought it.  I guess this proves my theory that education is generally an expensive process.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture, Great Wireless, Horrible sound quality
Reviews.Author: SmartMedia Card Repair "SmartMediaRepair"
Reviews.Content: Tv has a great picture with endless adjustments.  Wireless features are ample and wireless connectivity is good.  Sound is horrible.  I bought two of these TV's and they both sound the same. Sounds like people are talking into a tin can, or old am radio with no low frequency's. Small desktop speakers is a must so figure that into the price and clutter.

Reviews.Title: Great for the money
Reviews.Author: Billy Tucker "Perpetual Student"
Reviews.Content: At the time of this review I've owned this television for a couple of weeks.  It's picture is clear with vibrant colors.  I would not have expected anything more than it is.  If you have become accustomed to a giant screen TV then it requires some adjustment to get used to the 22 inch.I have thoroughly enjoyed using PANDORA internet radio which is packaged with the TV.  Since my backwater town of St. Louis, Missouri has lost its last classical music radio station I've found that the only way to get my music fix is through the internet.Two draw backs.  The audio is quite poor.  However, I had a couple of old speakers designed for PCs that I plugged into the headphone jack in the back of the device.  Problem solved.  My other objection is to the necessity that the remote control be used to address all of the TV's features.  Over the course of time remote controls tend to get worn or broken, and with this TV you might just be out of luck unless you can scrounge up a compatible Vizio remote somewhere.All-in-all it is a fine purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great picture...BUT....
Reviews.Author: Maryanne T. "Pretty Opinionated"
Reviews.Content: OK, I thought it was me, but apparently others have had the turning on in the middle of the night problem as well!I got this TV as a Christmas gift, but didn't open it until we moved into a new house at the end of January.In the 3-4 weeks since the tv has been opened and hooked up, it's turned on by itself at least 3 times.Every time was in the middle of the night, with everyone asleep.  The remote was untouched by people or pets... and no one was around using any other electronics at the time.  VERY weird! We are just using this tv as a kitchen tv, mostly for the grandkids when they visit, so it's not being used a lot.  We have not had the tv turn off by itself, yet, only on.Also the sound quality on this 22" tv is pretty awful.  It's like listening to an ol' time transistor radio.No bass range at all.  I have 2 other (larger, HD) Vizio flat screen TVs and I'm completely satisfied with every feature of each one, sound included.  This TV just doesn't measure up to the others...

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: DA Wolfe
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as both a second TV and as a computer monitor.  As a TV, it's fine.  Picture quality is good but could use some better speakers.  This could easily be remedied with a cheap set of computer speakers.  Setup was easy except for the registration process...not difficult, but somewhat tedious and time consuming. You have to scroll through the alphabet to enter each letter or number.  Navigation is a little more difficult than my 32" Visio but it has features (web apps) that my larger one doesn't so it's kind of a wash.Overall, I'm satisfied with the product and would recommend it as a better choice than buying a computer monitor of the same size since you can use it to run things like facebook, netflix etc indendent of your computer.

Reviews.Title: Remote frustrating, time consuming
Reviews.Author: kaykay
Reviews.Content: For a small bedroom, its size, sound and picture quality is satisfactory but....using the remote to input any info for the internet apps...forget it.  You can't use the qwty remote with this (I asked), a wireless keyboard doesn't work (I tried then asked after failure). I purchased an internet ready TV for the purpose of the internet otherwise I would have just gotten a TV. Nor did I want this as an additional monitor for my computer so having to have my laptop on at the same time as this TV defeats the purpose. If there is a solution to this (other than hooking to my computer), please let me know and I will update my review.

Reviews.Title: Junk
Reviews.Author: Craig LaPaglia
Reviews.Content: I've always been a Samsung TV person, we have a few and have never had any issues.  We started to look for a smaller TV for our bedroom with Netflix built in so we could move our (Samsung) 32" LCD and Apple TV 2nd Gen to our finished basement.  To my surprise, this Vizio television was the highest rated LED TV on Amazon for 21" - 29" sizes.  Based on the reviews I read I decided to give it a shot...Got it delivered and set it up in my living room - no problems connecting to wireless or setting up Netflix or anything, but the remote was awful; it was like some sort of child's toy remote or something.Once I had the initial setup done I moved it upstairs to the bedroom.  We don't really watch that much TV in our bedroom so about 10 days later I go to turn it on and it's dead - it won't do anything.  The Vizio logo is lit up as always, but no picture.  Unplugged it for a while and tried again, still nothing.  Printed out the return label and sent it on back.  Now I notice it's about $30 more than what I paid for it...I don't think I'll be purchasing another Vizio product.  Should have gone with my gut and stuck to the Samsung...

Reviews.Title: Good Set
Reviews.Author: DJRob
Reviews.Content: I'd say this is a good TV and a good value overall. It seems to be well built and feels of quality. The picture quality could not be better for a small and relatively cheap set.The remote is not that bad. I have a drawer full of remotes from various TVs, receivers, and other gear and it is rare that the remote that comes with a product is well laid out and comfortable to use- with few exceptions. Could it be better, yes. Would it stop me from buying the set, no. I think there was a design change in the remote, since the one that shipped with my set does not look like the one pictured in the manual. Buttons are in pretty much the same place, but the shape is more brick-like than curvy. So I guess Vizio made a running change. Not sure if I have the old style or new.Configuring and WIFI was easy to setup. Found my wireless right away. Word of caution: don't spend a lot of time adding apps and configuring them to your liking for the first couple of days, since Vizio pushes firmware updates in the background (which you have no control over) and I have twice had to add back in apps, delete the pre-installed apps I did not want, and (like with Pandora) re-enter my username/passwords. Some of the available apps fall way short of their potential or are pure garbage.The QAM tuner had no problems finding several non-encrypted channels on my Comcast service, and while the process is a bit tedious, it is easy to delete (skip) channels you don't care to watch. One disappointment is that the TV does not allow you to manually apply a label to the channels. While the set tags some channels from the data received over the cable, many are just numbers.The Bad:>Like other reviewers have stated the sound quality is pretty tinny. There is not much hope for it, regardless of the settings and EQ. No low-end at all. This is the major flaw of this otherwise pretty good TV. I'm sure the sound would be fantastic if output to an external amp and speakers.>The wall mounting arrangement could be improved. Most wall-mountable sets are pre-tooled to accept a VESA standard mount directly to the back of the set. This one has an adapter (included) that attaches in place of the tabletop stand that can be wall mounted directly or mated to a VESA type wall bracket. This will make the set stand out from the wall more than some might like when coupled with another bracket. In my installation, this was not an issue (corner mounted with an articulating bracket), but I do not like how the Vizio wall adapter attaches low on the set, making hard to conceal the mounting. An unintended plus: I was able to set the AC power brick on the Vizio bracket hinge to stow it out of sight.>The set has pretty good viewing angles side to side, but not from below. So, if you mount it high on a wall, the picture will wash out if you stand below the set and look up at it. Seems okay from a few feet back, however.>Start up time is a bit long, at about 10 seconds.>The lighted logo. I would say this is very well done with a quality, flush look that is evenly illuminated. It is amber when the set is off, and white when on. Unfortunately, there is no way to turn it off- at all. It can be distracting at times (dark scenes with room lights dimmed) and would be annoying to have that amber glow in a bedroom at night- unless, of course, you needed a nightlight, then it's a bonus! A little black tape does the trick.

Reviews.Title: Nice little TV
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: We have had this TV for a couple of weeks now and for the price I think it was a great purchase. I had been using a laptop connected to my daughter's TV to get Netflix on there and it was just okay. I hooked this TV up as a replacement and its been an awesome upgrade. I can't speak to the performance of the wireless because I have it hooked up via ethernet but the ease of use is very nice. My daughter is 8 years old and she can work the menus very easy, unless we are talking about the sleep timer and I think that she has issues there because she likes to sleep with the TV on although the sleep time is not as easy as a one-button setup. The picture quality is great. The Netflix programs will start off a little pixelized but when the program is buffered the quality smooths out. The viewing angles are good too. One complaint it that the inputs are all directly out of the back. I prefer when they are parallel to the screen so you can mount the TV flat against the wall. That being said we chose to sit it on a dresser where it works fine. The remote seems kind of big, I thought that it had a min-keyboard stashed beneath the regular keypad but I guess its just fat. I haven't done much with the Prime video supplied by Amazon, other than to sign in and get it connected. Once more programming shows up I will have to try it out. As for the Facebook and Twitter apps I can't say much there either. I don't want my Facebook or Twitter stuff showing up on my daughter's TV so I didn't login to those services. In conclusion I really like the TV and the price was unbeatable from Amazon, not to mention it was delivered in just over 24 hours without paying for next day delivery though I do have a Prime account.

Reviews.Title: Amazing HDTV for gaming!
Reviews.Author: Ana E. Rivas
Reviews.Content: I bought this HDTV primarily to play on my Xbox 360. So far, it's been amazing.The picture quality is superb, the only bad thing is that the sound bar faces downwards, so the sound sounds kinda weird.I used Component cables to connect my 360(older model), so I had to use the Audio-to-Red/White adapter for sound and the VGA-to-Component adapter for video. It was a bit annoying doing that, but it works perfectly, so it's just a minor gripe.I connected the TV to my home's Wi-Fi and it worked perfectly. The apps are a bit meh, but it's a nice bonus. No complaint there really.Overall, for $228 (what I payed), 5/5 for a 22" 1080p with Internet apps!EDIT: Nov. 2012 update. TV still works great! I'm now using HDMI to connect both my Xbox 360 and PS3, and they both work great. Very easy to switch between HDMI inputs with the remote.Once again, 5/5!

Reviews.Title: good picture and connectivity
Reviews.Author: A. Mdivanimorrow "Ani's Art"
Reviews.Content: The set install easy to figure out and operation for wireless use was straightforward. Great picture but as in flatscreens in this size with tiny speakers it is hard to get great sound. The sound is satisfactory.  I bought this set used via Amazon and it was in like new condition and I had no issues. You do have to read the instuctions to get learn how to use the single control for manual setup [and to reset controls] but that is pretty straightforward once you try it. The remote was easy to use. I'm connected via a digital antenna and it has good reception.

Reviews.Title: Hard to beat at this price
Reviews.Author: Western-NY "hurler2000"
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews that knocked this TV's sound quality.  It isn't great, but playing with the multiple sound options on the menu I was able to get decent sound from it.  The picture quality is superb (as it should be with 1080p on a 22" screen).  Easy set up and lots of nice internet / web options.  Began streaming Netflix right away.  Nice small foot print but includes a wall mount if you want it.

Reviews.Title: j.gardner
Reviews.Author: Jarvis Gardner
Reviews.Content: This is great t.v. It has alot great apps like Amazon On Demand NBA Gametime, Facebook. Tons web shows. Even has intune internet radio. But I have two problems first sound is pretty bad but all have you use good computer speaker makes sound better. I myself using L0GITECH S120 speaker which can get pretty loud.  Second the remote is very cheap. The directional bottons and ok is very made of poor quanity. T.v.has a beautiful picture. For this price can be beat for t.v with wifi.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, not-so-great remote
Reviews.Author: C. Godfrey
Reviews.Content: The TV is all that Vizio states that it is and more but I am disappointed that the remote for the 22-inch TV does not have the the slide out keyboard on it.  The video showing that remote, at least for the 22-inch model, is deceiving as you will get a standard remote only.  There is an option to bring up a keyboard but there is really no point in trying to post on, for example, Facebook as you will be taking 3 times as long to type a message with it.  Also, you cannot just buy the slide out keyboard remote on Vizio's website, at least not yet.  All-in-all it's a great TV but if you can afford a larger TV with the better remote, get it.

Reviews.Title: Great picture but sound is not good
Reviews.Author: Tammy
Reviews.Content: I have had this tv for awhile now. I like the internet function and the picture is great. The sound however is not good at all. I think this particular tv had the worst sound quality I have come across.

Reviews.Title: Terrible!
Reviews.Author: Robert Smith "helobob"
Reviews.Content: Sound is absolutely terrible.  If you turn it up high enough to hear it is is totally garbled.  Beware of this problem.

Reviews.Title: Nicely priced, only if it worked. ***Warning***
Reviews.Author: Dmitriy Zak
Reviews.Content: When i brought this TV from Amazon, i was very excited, i got an excellent price on it, it had internet connection and was happen to finally put a flat screen TV in my kitchen. The shipping was fast as always with Amazon, I opened it up the day i got it set it up and got down to business watching it. I watched the TV maybe about 5-6 times in a 4 month period of having it. One day i was in my kitchen making breakfast watching Netflix on the TV when the TV frozen up, naturally i though it was the Netflix. I tried to stop the netflix, didnt work, tried to turn off the tv, didnt work, not a single button on the remote worked, plus on top of that the tv wouldnt shut off from the power button on the tv it self. So i unplugged it, waited a few minutes, and plugged it back in. The Vizio symbol started to blink orange and then nothing, the screen was black the vizio symbol white. I started searching online for answer and found out that this is a very common and typical problem with this model tv. Luckily Amazon, being so great, offered to give me a full refund. I returned it and never looked back. MUST SURE YOU READ THE REVIEWS AND DO YOUR RESEARCH BEFORE BUYING A PRODUCT LIKE THIS ONE.

Reviews.Title: Black Screen Vizio
Reviews.Author: gunner
Reviews.Content: The 22" Vizio LCD I purchased on Amazon quit working about 41 days after I received it.[ASIN:B003VQQVDU VIZIO M221NV 22-Inch Full HD 1080p LED LCD TV with VIA Internet Applications, Black]] It operated a bit weird on start up.  The Vizio icon would flash orange without the screen turning on and then it would shut down.  Second attempt to turn it on would work properly.  On the 41st day, when I attempted to turn it on, it popped and the screen never came on.  There was audio and a burnt smell.  So, my 30 day return window was gone.  Thanks to Amazon, I was still able to return it. Amazon also paid for the return shipping.

Reviews.Title: An unusually poor performer for VIZIO
Reviews.Author: A
Reviews.Content: Wireless WIFI feature NOT user friendly. Difficult to navigate anything because only keyboard is on screen and that is diffecult to bring up sometimes. Apps disappear and the menu that allows selecting new apps disappeared after the last software update. Television will lock up sometimes or won't turn on at all until unplugged overnight. I have found because of the difficulty navigating in the apps on the TV that the WIFI feature was a waste. I have an older VIZIO that was a great TV and with VIZIO's reputation, this TV has been a real disappointment.

Reviews.Title: Good enough
Reviews.Author: Florence Vicil Anaya "dynamomelano"
Reviews.Content: Image and sound are fine. There are many useless apps. The app I use the most is Netflix, and this one does not keep track of my viewing very well. Sometimes interferes with some electronics. The remote is clunky, cheap, not backlighted, does not let you navigate easily, and definitely not the one depicted in the user's manual. But overall, good enough for me.

Reviews.Title: VIZIO - from Amazon - Second TV
Reviews.Author: Richard Dlugosz "RD_Tarkus"
Reviews.Content: Delivery was within 5 days of purchase. That was great.This seemed a good choice for a second TV that could be moved from one room to another with ease. The WI-FI option was essential.I did have one major problem. When I turned the TV on, it could not find any of the cable channels and I continued to get error messages. I shortly realized the "remote" was also turning my other TV on and off.I called VIZIO tech support. Only had to hold for less than 2 minutes. The first person I spoke with was in Florida. She set up the information for my account but said she could not answer my questions because the set was new and she was not trained on that item. She transferred me to another person in Utah. It only took another minute or so.This person (Michael) stayed on the line and helped me reset the TV and get it up and running.The problem was I have another VIZIO 55" 3D TV. It was turned on in the other room. When I hit the power switch for the new TV, they "synced" together as one. SO, if you have more than one VIZIO, make certain to shut down all others BEFORE turning on the new one for setup.Otherwise, the TV is great. The base is solid enough to prevent tipping. The screen can be tilted if desired. There are several back panel hookups plus the WI-FI for Internet Apps.The sound is not the best. That might be the room I have it in but adding another set of speakers might be a better option.I am happy with my VIZIO (both of them) and just as pleased with the prompt TECH SUPPORT from the company. If all customers are handled as I was, this company will be moving ahead fast.

Reviews.Title: Overall...great TV
Reviews.Author: D. Diamond "D"
Reviews.Content: Fantastic picture with HD and the internet apps are better than your standard apps that you get on a Roku box.The badThe default sound is horrible.  However, if you change the settings to turn off the SRS TruSurround HDTM audio and turn up the bass, it sounds much better.  Not fantastic but much better than the default "tin can" sound.  Its amazing to me that the default setting is that bad.If you're using it in your bedroom, you may not appreciate the backlit VIZIO logo that stays on even when the unit is off or the bright blue light on the wall plug.  I use it in the kitchen so its not a factor.The buttons on the remote are a 3 or 4 on a scale of 1-10.  The navigation buttons frequently move several spots with one touch and trying to enter your email address is almost torturous.  Thank goodness things like that only need to be entered infrequently.The TV takes longer than a normal TV to turn on.  Its probably something to do with the fact that its loading up the internet apps.The GoodThe apps are fantastic and a 10 on a scale of 1-10.The picture is extremely good.2 HDMI portsBuilt in WIFI rocksPrice - I found it for $229Wish ListSwivel base.  This looks like it swivels but it doesn'tBetter remote3rd HDMI port might be nice but certainly not necessary

Reviews.Title: The Kids love it!
Reviews.Author: malcolm sims
Reviews.Content: I bought 2 of these for my girls for Christmas and they love them! They don't have cable in their rooms but they are able to  use the Internet Apps to watch Netflix and the various other Apps.The sound is not that very good but they have no complaints. I'm very happy with my purchase...

Reviews.Title: So Far So Good
Reviews.Author: BrianOC "b"
Reviews.Content: Well I just got my TV today (Sam's Club for $199, now selling for $269) and I really like it.  Set up was pretty simple, and I was able to link my Netflix and Amazon VOD accounts no problem. The sound is ok for the bedroom where I have the TV, but external speakers wouldn't be a bad idea.  This is my first Vizio, as I typically like Sony or Samsung TV's.  The Yahoo weather and news apps have been on and off, but everything else is working well.

Reviews.Title: Great computer monitor with extras
Reviews.Author: Mike Hathaway
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace a 15" monitor in a workroom.This TV is really sort of cross over.  Its a great TV and a great monitor.  With 4 HDMI ports, A tuner, VGA and Sound for the computer plus your standard analog ports for an old vcr or dvd player you can hook anything and everything into it at the same time.  The speakers fill a bedroom with plenty of sound.The real bonus is the internet apps.  Being able to stream Netflix was that little extra that made this the perfect small room TV.  The only problem is either the remote is week or the sensor on the front is week, because you have to point it directly at the small infra port to get the TV to respond to the remote.I would buy this again.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for Dad
Reviews.Author: Pen and Teller
Reviews.Content: I was looking all over the place for a TV that:1.  Easy to use for a Senior Citizen2.  Had Netflix3.  Compact and small4.  Good quality pictureVizio Internet Apps TV fit the bill. My Dad has no idea how to work computers and he found the Vizio TV to be easy to use.  He watches Netflix every day. The quality is great and it is so light, he can move it anywhere in his small apartment.Are there other TVs out there that with better picture quality?  Of course, but for now, there is nothing out there that has Internet applications built in.  Especially for my Dad, it will just confuse him if you have all the different gadgets connected to the TV.The only thing I could have wished for was an integrated DVD player.  Maybe next time.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely beautiful picture
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my mother as an early Christmas gift. She loves it! This television is absolutely beautiful! The picture is stunning! I have a 40 inch Samsung LCD, but this television is even clearer than mine! So easy to put together and set up. And all those apps put this television over the top. Weather, finance, and other wonderful features. Absolutely beautiful! Five stars!

Reviews.Title: Really wanted it to work
Reviews.Author: K. Allen
Reviews.Content: I was so excited about this TV and being able to access Netflix from the bedroom. However, I was unable to connect to the internet with it. I tried repeatedly, following directions exactly but it would not connect.  I brought it to the living room and connected by wire and it worked perfectly but I couldn't get a wireless connection no matter what. I called tech support and they were very nice but I was told I had to have a WPA connection rather than a WEP connection. I was told I'd have to change my whole household over to WPA in order to connect.  It didn't sound right to me and after much research on how to do this, I decided it wasn't worth the trouble.  If I can't connect with the internet setup I already have, it's pretty much useless to me.  Having said that, I thought the picture quality was very good, the sound was good for me and the design was nice.  The on screen print for menu items was pretty small though and hard to read across a small bedroom.  Other than that, I liked the TV but wasn't willing to pay more for a feature I couldn't use (internet) and I sent it back.

Reviews.Title: Great TV but you will need to buy decent speakers to go with it!!
Reviews.Author: A. Harford "Student09"
Reviews.Content: This TV is great!  The only problem is that the sound quality is extremely tinny.  Solution: Grab a pair of inexpensive speakers.  I picked up the Logitech Speaker System Z323 with Subwoofer and it made a huge difference!My favorite feature is that this TV is internet enabled and comes with apps.  I don't even bother with cable because I have a Netflix account and can watch it directly on the TV without hooking anything up.I definitely recommend this TV, but don't expect much in terms of sound quality.  You will need to get good speakers to go with it.  It is especially great if you are a Netflix or Hulu person.  The wireless connectivity is fast and easy and it is my favorite feature about this TV.

Reviews.Title: Nice internet connected TV - weak built-in speakers
Reviews.Author: JT "James"
Reviews.Content: Got the Vizio M221NV used but in excellent condition. Internet apps/widgets add nice options for viewing more content. Netflix works well, streams quickly with no issues. Would like to see a you tube widget added.  Improved the surprisingly weak built-in sound quality by connecting Altec Lansing BXR1220 usb powered speakers. Easy connection to the rear stereo miniplug (automatically turns off weak internal speakers) and USB port on the back of the TV provides the power. The speakers add a fuller sound...brings it up to a very acceptable tv sound quality for little cost.

Reviews.Title: Does not connect to Internet
Reviews.Author: Nicholas Richman
Reviews.Content: Vizio has a significant problem in that it will not connect to higher-level encryption in a wi-fi network.  My house/business runs smoothly on WPA-encrypted systems (combination Time Warner and Apple products) and the Vizio TV will not connect to that.  In talking with Vizio help-desk (not that helpful in reality) their only suggestion is that I rebuild/downgrade the network to WEP so that it can fit with Vizio.  So your choice is to lessen your security for a TV or dump the TV.I'm returning the TV.

Reviews.Title: not worth it
Reviews.Author: aardvark
Reviews.Content: I had problems with this item since I got it. The wi-fi in the tv decides when it wants to retrieve info from the internet. Usually, right in the middle of a program you are watching This process takes about 5 min. or so to complete.(not good). Now after 9 months, the internet apps have died. Amazon offered me 50 cents on the dollar to take this hunk of junk back.Oh, plus I have to pay shipping costs and I lose a $60.00 credit that I applied when I purchased the item. For the amount of money i'll be out, I could go to Walmart and get a new set. That's what I get for buying amazon second quality products.

Reviews.Title: Neat concept, some improvements needed with sound and remote
Reviews.Author: E. Orchard "I love lamp"
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV at Super Target over a year ago. I thought the Internet apps were a great idea. In concept, they are, but the remote is so bad that is makes navigation a pain in the bum. Also, the Hulu app is pretty awful to navigate as well. In fact, one of my biggest complaints with this TV is the remote. The remote either lags or double presses when you use it. The apps are slow to move through - you have to click through each one to get to the one you need. I suspect the interface will improve with time.Though this TV boasts "SRS TruVolume and SRS TruSurroundHDTM audio" the sound is not great. I messed with several settings and just could not get a sound I liked. I ended up plugging in external speakers to get a decent sound to come out of the TV.The wi-fi is good. We don't use it a lot (only needed for the TV apps). We did have problems with it once where it wouldn't connect to our internet.The picture is good. No complaints there. We can even get OTA channels with an antenna and they come in in HD.Turn on to image time is long, but that's not a concern for me. I can wait 10 seconds. ;)I really do enjoy the slim profile. So much nicer than the 20" deep TV I replaced! I have more room on my dresser now.I see that there are firmware updates available. I'll definitely check those out.

Reviews.Title: Not so great
Reviews.Author: Amazon Fan "Amazon Fan"
Reviews.Content: Needed a small tv for my bedroom. Takes 12 seconds for it to turn on, screen is dark on the best setting. If I had bought it locally I would have returned it. Own a 56" Vizio and love it...guess bigger is better...when it comes to tv's.

Reviews.Title: TV
Reviews.Author: Roger
Reviews.Content: If I had known the only audio output was fiber optic and the speaker that comes on it was so cheap I would have reconsidered.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't get the color to look right
Reviews.Author: Trevor Price
Reviews.Content: I bought this to use as a TV and a second monitor for my computer.  I like the apps feature and the little bit I used it it was very nice, Netflix was easy to setup.  It has a lot of color issues, way too bright with the brightness turned up, seems to turn kinda purple with it turned down.  No matter how much I adjusted the color I kept finding that it seemed to drift after a few minutes of use.  As a computer monitor this gets one star.  The color issues aren't as noticeable when watching TV as when it's being used as a monitor.  If you are going to use this as an extra TV for a bedroom or something like that I think it will be fine for most people.  I'm fairly picky about color and thought I would be able to get it to look good but I've given up, I'm returning it.Speakers seem to have a delay some of the time after a quiet moment.  They sound REALLY bad to me, over processed.Good:* Low Price* Small size* Nice stable base* Apps!  Netflix, Hulu, Etc.Cons:* Bad color, purpleish tint* White doesn't look right* Speakers sound badWould be great as a cheap TV for a bedroom, dorm room if you're not too picky.

Reviews.Title: No one ever regretted spending a little extra for quality
Reviews.Author: W. Brandenburg "BB"
Reviews.Content: Update at bottom.Bought this TV at Costco because of their 90 day return policy.  Unfortunately that wasn't quite long enough: at 141 days the TV tuner's audio function failed (although the non broadcast audio inputs still work).  Even on day 1, the sound quality was no better than a $9 clock radio: very thin case + small rear firing speakers contribute to unusually tinny sound (Folks, what's the fascination with ultra thin cases, anyway?  It only makes the audio engineer's job more difficult).  In the past few weeks the picture has been flickering on and off.  When the picture flickers back on, the channel indicator comes on, which might or might not mean that the signal has been lost because the video portion of the tuner is also failing.  (Or my OTA antenna is not strong enough, or the Vizio's tuner is not sensitive enough.  Problem is intermittent, increasing in frequency)  Regarding the internet streaming function, it takes 2.5 to 3 minutes to handshake with Netflix via both WIFI and hard wired Ethernet cable before a movie begins to play, or to restart movie playing after a long pause.  By way of comparison, a Roku box feeding into the same TV only takes 20 seconds to start a movie via WIFI.  Additionally, the TV has lost track of the WIFI network security code, requiring reentry a couple of times.  Positives are that the remote and case are pleasant looking (the case is ultra thin!), and the picture is bright enough when viewed straight on (there is significant light falloff when viewed above or below the screen's central axis, not as bad laterally).  Too bad that this TV's reliability and functionality come up seriously short or fail in multiple categories.  While many Amazon reviews report high levels of satisfaction with the Vizio brand, from here it looks like a crap shoot.  Stung once, next time I'll put less emphasis on extra features at a low price, and look for more highly regarded brands reviewed on Amazon and ConsumerSearch.  Unfortunately, detailed TV reliability data is hard to find.  Maybe the next TV will cost me an extra $50.  Worth it.Update: sound started working correctly again, who knows what was going on.  Shortly after I wrote the review, and for the first time, the wireless streaming function started working as quickly as a Roku box, that is without the previous 2.5 to 3 minute delay.  Rating raised from two to three stars.

Reviews.Title: Vizio M221NV 22 inch HD TV
Reviews.Author: C. Brooks
Reviews.Content: The Vizio has some fine features. The wireless internet T.V. and picture quality is outstanding quality. The only draw back is when I hid my wireless signal from public searches, the TV no longer finds the signal even after manual input is rendered into the TV itself. But easily remedied by not hiding the signal, which is not required by most users. The 22 inch is perfect for bedroom use, but for some reason Vizio added a light to the Vizio logo and power cord. Surprisingly, the blue light on the cord is brighter than the logo light. While it's cool during day use, it's not so nice in a bedroom, particularly if you like the room completely void of lights. But easily remedied with electrical tape placed over logo and cord. The wireless even works well three stories away from the router.The sound is definitely not the best quality. At first I didn't notice the huge sound discrepancy between stations and the included Internet apps, such as Hulu, Netfix and Amazon Plus. On some shows I could barely hear get the volume past a whisper. I've since hooked up a pair of after market speakers to fix this issue. Unsure if it's an app issue or the TV but regardless the speakers were not working well on different channels, something the new speakers remedied.The remote control was not designed for human hands, it's shaped like a brick with very little comfort but easy to navigate. The keys are somewhat low profile and it's easy to hit the wrong one if not paying attention.All in all I really enjoy the features and only took off one star for the poor quality sound. Everything else is minor in comparison to the quality and price of this t.v.UPDATE: After almost two months of use, This week, I've noticed the TV turns off periodically and reboots. It's quite annoying and after some research I discovered this is an issue with almost all the Vizio T.V.s. Just Google "Vizio tv turns off" and you will find others with the same issue and Youtube demonstrations of what the tv is doing. I must reiterate this TV has an awesome picture...if you can see it. Now I'm told Amazon won't refund all my money due to the fact, it's more than 30 days. Buyer Beware. I down graded this to TV to two stars from four

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV; Troublesome App (VIA)
Reviews.Author: Paul Andrew Anderson
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a top electronic product. I have Vizio bluetooth headphones which are an awesome match to my Amazon.com-purchased ASUS netbook. All factors are rated high (pic, sound, etc.) and I still recommend Vizio as a TV brand. The problem was/is in the App; VIA software. Because there's no keyboard, only a remote, the initial setup is time-consuming; however, you'd think that once you do it you are done. However, I've had to do it several times now, as this is the prescribed solution from Vizio, whenever the internet does not allow Netflix, Facebook or Hulu Plus (any internet app) to connect. I will try to connect one, and the results say that it cannot connect to the internet. I can run a connection test, which produces the download speed of the connection; my TV is Ethernet-connected to my surfboard wireless cable modem.I contacted Vizio by email, my preference; they did reply promptly, recommending "power cycling" - unplug the TV & Modem for a half-minute and then wait for everything to reset. If this does not work (and it rarely does), then you must reset your TV from scratch; a long tedious process. I told Vizio that no customer wants to go through all these steps just to watch TV. Finally they gave me their toll-free number but offered no final solution, and I believe it's because they know of the flaw; a software problem, but they yet to have a cheap solution (too expensive to recall all VIA-ready TVs). I suggested an over-the-net patch, much like what is done w/computers, for this portion of the TV is a computer.I'm guessing that this is not limited to the Vizio brand however, because the same App program can be found in many other TV brands. Whenever my TV refuses to connect the TV app (the VIA) I can still connect to Netflix (wirelessly) with my ASUS net book tethered to my TV, and watch Netflix that way; the TV becomes a monitor. Now, since you can do this with any PC (tower or laptop) with a wired connection (RGB or HDMI) to any modern TV, the decision becomes, if you want to spend extra for the Internet App on any TV brand, or for now, just buy a tether and use a PC until they master the technology. As for a TV, Vizio is excellent, and all other features work as listed in product description!

Reviews.Title: Terrific little tv except for the sound
Reviews.Author: Candice
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to buy a tv sight unseen,especially from a new company, but I am glad I did. The picture quality is wonderful (turn off the ambient lighting setting for a brighter picture). I have not had any problems with the wifi. I am using Cisco-Valet Plus Wireless Router, which is very simple to install. Provides a strong steady signal even with DSL. The sound quality is pretty poor, but then again where are you going to put speakers in a 2" wide TV. There is no need to buy the sound bar, Logitech X-140 2.0 Speakers are very good and fit nicely to either side of the television. Don't get too excited about Facebook. You can read news feeds, but not not status updates from friends. You can type in a status feed, but without a keyboard it will take forever. Netflix is great (so what if the price is going up. If you watch 2 movies you have gotten your moneys worth.) I watch a lot of TV shows on Netflix (no commercials!)I am hoping that they will offer a remote with a slide out keyboard in the future. One comes with the larger vizio via, but not the 22. I would have paid a few dollars more.Very simple setup. If you want to secure it down a little use self adhesive velcro.I used the RGB setup for my DVD player and the picture is much better. You will need a female to male adapter (ebay).I had a question for vizio customer service and they are great.All in all a very good TV especially for the availble features for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great small TV
Reviews.Author: Kenneth Moore
Reviews.Content: Nice crisp and bright display. The navigation isn't hard to go through. Setup wasn't hard for the internet. Netflix works great, I had no trouble with setting it up and watching a few episodes of Family Guy. There is some slowdown when moving around the menues however. The speakers aren't too great also. If it's for a small room, then I wouldn't be worried about it, the sound is just fine. I have this setup in my baby-to-be room attached to the wall with a wall mount. Works great. I definetly recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: This device is a great price, seamless, and idoit proof
Reviews.Author: Consumer 5 "personalized signature"
Reviews.Content: I did not have I expectations due to the very reasonable price but this TV is great, made cable cutting that much easier.  Connected to my WiFi in 30 seconds, and NetFlixs took another 60 seconds. Based ob my prior experiences with WiFi I tought I was in for a 2 hour project, and was sightly disappointed that my project was cut short by a well designed machines. I feel like my mom could set this IPTV up. The TV covers the important apps NetFlixs, Rhaspody (works great low the cheap streaming app), Pandora, Amazon VOD, weather, news, facebook, etc. (still not as big as what Andriod offers, but the important stuff is there). Also, not a touch screen, but remote works good enough, as I would not want to get up very time to play with it. A remote would be nice, but still, for the price great job Vizio.

Reviews.Title: Love it, but it turns itself on!!
Reviews.Author: cheryl
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for about 2 months and today was the fourth time I found it on - all by itself. Got spooked the first time b/c I was sleeping and thought there were intruders in another part of the house.  I read these reviews prior to buying it and read another reviewer's comment that it powered itself on.  But I got it anyway b/c of the positive reviews.  I use it only as a TV despite all the other neat things it can do.  Picture and sound are fine for me.  I don't feel like returning it solely b/c of its independent nature of going on by itself, hoping this quirk is not dangerous, and planning to hook it up to a power strip as it's a second, not used much TV.  Anybody have same issue that they've solved without returning it?

Reviews.Title: Visio M22INV LED TV
Reviews.Author: J. R. Bedwell
Reviews.Content: Received TV very quickly(about 3 days) & in good condition.  Easy to set-up, very good picture quality.  My only negative is the audio quality but, with very little space for speakers, you couldn't expect much better.  Nice TV for bedroom or small room.

Reviews.Title: Great Little TV!
Reviews.Author: The Mansfield Schikevitz
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted a small TV for our bedroom. Since we had a Vizio 49" with VIA for the living room we looked into other Vizio TV's with VIA that were the size we wanted for the bedroom. This was important due to the fact we have been totally liberated from the cost of cable and view everything using apps and internet. (Best move we ever made) The apps work great, the TV looks great, and the sound is perfect for a room that is as big as our bedroom. We are considering getting another one for our second house. Also, we purchased a used one from the Amazon store and it has been flawless.

Reviews.Title: Terrific Versatile TV and LED/LCD Display
Reviews.Author: A. Tievsky
Reviews.Content: I am very picky about my video. But in this case I was looking for a budget TV for my breakfast room to replace an old 15 inch tube model in a small space. I already have 3 LCD TVs and 3 plasmas in the house and I didn't want to spend much. I found this one for under $200. I wasn't expecting much from this manufacturer,  which I had associated with discount stores. I also figured that 1080 in a small TV was a bit of hyperbole. I was dead wrong.This is a terrific television and a fantastic value. Now I'm thinking about buying another.Picture is exquisite. Easily as good as my more pricy Samsungs.The set is attractive and takes up very little space.Tuner is as good as any of my more expensive TVs.Connectivity is as good as it could be. More than most people will ever use. It even has optical audio out!Software and remote are straightforward, simple. The tuner pretty much does it's own thing. WI-FI works automatically on my home network. I was amazed when the set automatically uploaded and installed new firmware without a hitch. TV Internet aps are a nice touch. Easy to stream Netflix and frankly the movies look much better than on my computer. There are many aps loaded, most are free.Sound quality - well what did you expect from such a thin TV? I put some old computer speakers in back of it, where you can't see them, and now it's terrific. Recommend that practice for everyone.Summary: This is a great value and a terrific TV with features that would cost at least $200 more from the major brands.My only complaint is that I can't directly access media files on my networked hard drive without adding another box.

Reviews.Title: just purchased
Reviews.Author: Johninwny "john"
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv as an extra in a spare room, something to watch while on the tread mill. I love the internet apps and with my previous netflix subscription, it was a breeze to open my account. It also found my home wifi with no problem. I have not even connected the antenna as of yet to search for local tv channels. I love the internet apps option and the option of adding your own.The sound isn't the greatest  i suppose, but is sufficient. Also kind of a cheesy plastic remote, but it works ok. I would still buy this tv again, i don't regret my purchase thus far. For the price, it's not a bad deal. I hope my review is a help to others considering this TV.

Reviews.Title: Does the job.
Reviews.Author: Andrew
Reviews.Content: I was originally looking for a larger computer monitor for my 15" laptop to make the work I do a bit easier. I didn't want something huge, as I would be traveling with it also. If I were to spend so much money, I thought, I might as well get one with a TV tuner, or just get a TV that could double as a monitor. Having 1080p, LED, and the ability to stream Netflix were the features of this monitor - excuse me, TV - that were the selling point for me, as I could not find another one in this size and at this price point.Ease of setup without looking at the manual was good, though typing in all the information (name, email address, etc. for registration with Vizio and Wifi and Netflix registration) could have been easier if I could have plugged in a keyboard. Is that possible? I don't know, for I still haven't opened the manual yet. Locating and hooking up to our Wifi router was a breeze except for the former complaint of using the remote to type in the password.I originally was very close to returning this monitor/TV, for the first few minutes using it with my laptop gave me an incredible headache. I then got the bright idea that it may not be the monitor, but the settings. I changed the Picture Settings from Standard to Movie, which made reading the text MUCH easier on the eyes. I changed a couple of other settings that make it more visually manageable, such as turning the color enhancement off, noise reduction to low, Adaptive Luma to low, and Ambient Light Sensor to Middle. Therefore, I'm probably going to keep this thing.The thinness and weight are going to be VERY helpful in my travels; my, have we progressed since the days of luggables!It's much easier to see the pixellation (sp?) of text characters, which is not the fault of the monitor, but maybe a fault of Vista or my graphics processor, which is actually just shared memory. I might need to upgrade to a new laptop soon :-).There's only one button on the monitor itself, the power button, which has a rotating wheel around it. Pressing the power button brings up a small menu that includes controlling volume, channel, input source, exit, and power off. If you want to change anything else, DON'T LOSE THE REMOTE!!!!The aesthetics of the remote are very bland compared to a 32" Vizio within the family. It's more like a brick - short, fat, and a bit bulky. The buttons have a good clicking feel when pressed; it just doesn't seem like much thought was given to making it look pretty.The stand can let the TV tilt about five degrees down and twenty degrees up. That's a complete guess, and my profession is NOT in geometry.I haven't paid much attention to sound, but I'm sure it's crappy, as what other reviewers have said. Get external speakers, I guess.I would recommend this thing to someone else, if this is what he or she is wanting to buy.

Reviews.Title: goodbye Cable
Reviews.Author: lawrence sampson
Reviews.Content: Totally awesome, wireless is excellent, running flawlessly through 3 walls. Internet apps are the future now! Soon we can all tell those high costing cable companies where to stick it! Sound quality is average, but hey, this is a bedroom tv. So far so good.

Reviews.Title: Piece of Junk
Reviews.Author: Patience
Reviews.Content: This tv worked great for 20 days then started freezing up. Now I don't know if i'll get my money back. Don't buy this!

Reviews.Title: Great little tv for bedroom or kitchen
Reviews.Author: Kristin "Mommy of two"
Reviews.Content: UPDATE: Loved it until it died. This tv is less than 2 yrs old and has only had moderate use- watched for an average of an hour or so at night. Last week, it simply would not turn on. No power outage or surge, or anything to cause this issue. After googling, I know now this is a common problem with Vizio tvs. I will definitely never buy another Vizio after this. Our 3 yr old Sony is still going strong. Heck, my parents' ancient (10+ yrs) RCA big screen TV refuses to die.I purchased this a few months ago from sam's club for around $220 and think it was a great bargain. I debated between the 22, 26, or 32 inch televisions with internet applications. I decided 32" was overkill for the space (will only be viewing from less than 10 ft. away), and the size difference between the 22 & 26 was not enough to justify the $150 price difference. I am very pleased with the purchase. The picture is great and the sound is satisfactory. Set up was very easy, the stand was easy to attach (haven't gotten around to wall mounting yet) and it immediately picked up the wi-fi signal, I just had to enter my network password and was good to go. This is mainly used for streaming Netflix and watching blu-ray movies. I find the Netflix app very easy to navigate and actually like the setup more and find it more user-friendly than the one on my Sony blu-ray player in my living room.
