This is a great choice for a small space. This is my first Vizio, and so far am impressed by the quality.

Reviews.Title: Channels cut out
Reviews.Author: mr battery
Reviews.Content: Purchased because of price.  Connected to antenna to receive ota transmissions.  The channels keeps cutting out.  The channel will be fine for a while then blank screen for 3 sec.  Not having this problem with other ota tvs in the house.  Tuner must be very weak; don't know if you will have problems hooked up to cable.

Reviews.Title: Inexpensive, but quality display
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: Excellent lightweight and mobile display if you need it for that extra room or just to supplement whatever it is you have going on. Bright and crisp display don't disappoint. I got it for the small and light package because of the extra HDMI inputs and quality audio output. I use it in a small room I have on location and I couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: Lots of features in this bedroom sized LED
Reviews.Author: Mr. Derrick "Vitamin D"
Reviews.Content: Pros: Re-certified and received everything except for manual. Remote, mounting plate, power ac were included. No major scratches at all. Was shipped only in it's original box but arrived fine.Extremely light. This thing weighs under 8 pounds without the stand making it so easy to mount on a wall.Mounting plate makes it stick out over 2 inches plus more depending on the wall mount used.Picture looks great. This is my first LED LCD and the difference is very noticeable.Cons: Not a fan of the remote. The 'ok' button is located in the middle of the 4 directional buttons and is a bit weird to press without clicking the others. Also when using the buttons I sometimes get double clicks...so instead of moving up 1 time it moves 2 times.Sound is nothing great but to be expected really. You are able to make changes to the EQ and it does help. A little more mid-range would have been great and there isn't much low end at all which gives it a tinny sound. But again this works perfect for the bedroom. I looked forever trying to find a small sound bar but everything I could find was over 30 inches long...would not have looked to good under the tv that is 22 inches. I already owned the Monster ClarityHD Precision Micro Bluetooth Speaker 100 Portable Bluetooth Speaker (MBL CLY SPKR BT) and decided to hook it up to hear the difference. Oh man so much better. Stereo separation is not the best but for bedroom sound it really does sound much better. It added more midrange and just enough bass to round it out. The good thing is the Monster speaker has 1/8 input and uses USB to keep it charged so I was able to use both of those connections on the Vizio.Firmware can be a pain. I bought this to use Hulu Plus and it took 3 firmware upgrades before it appeared. You cannot do a manual update. So the tv needs to be in standby to update. Once you turn it on again the upgrade may appear. I had to do this a couple times before it happened. I would liked to see it update all at once but for some reason I had to use many different firmwares to finally get it to the latest.Vizio logo is too bright and can't be turned of.Widgets are ok. At this time 19 pages of widgets available with I believe 10 on each page.I honestly bought this just to use Prime Instant videos, and Hulu Plus. I don't have anything else connected to it at this time.Very happy with it so far and too good of a deal to pass up at this re-certified price.

Reviews.Title: Really like it!
Reviews.Author: BillG
Reviews.Content: Ordered on a Monday, at the house on Thursday.  Took all of 15 minutes to set up and connect the internet.  Great picture, sound not so good.  Not an audiophile, so I attached a pair of cheap external speakers, and sounds fine to me.  Netflix streams without a problem, and still learning about everything else!  As a second set in our bedroom it is great!

Reviews.Title: great picture
Reviews.Author: max
Reviews.Content: works well--- LED is brillianthad to purchase speakers and that made a world of difference for the sound

Reviews.Title: Unique in its class
Reviews.Author: James E. Tucker "Macintosh pioneer"
Reviews.Content: After 5 years we decided to replace the little tube Samsung set on my bedroom chest of drawers. We had 24 inches to work with, not a fraction more. My criteria was (after size fit), full HD and internet apps. After shopping at all our local bricks & mortar stores, plus a lot of on line browsing, I determined that this little Vizio was the only product that had the features I wanted in the size I needed. We love it! Great picture, internet apps are easy to use and the limited quality built in sound isn't a problem because we ran a mini-pin head phone line extension over to the iPod boom box by our bed to provide a full range sound to our liking. I'd recommend this TV to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Nice little LCD
Reviews.Author: Michael P. Neavear
Reviews.Content: works well out of the box. Reception of wireless signal could be a bit better. Smart phone receives a slightly stronger signal in that part of the house, but it doesn't appear to affect the operation of the unit.One glitch arose about a week into using it. The remote just stopped working. Using the troubleshoot guide (what could it be besides battery, really? lol) led me to something else. The control knob on the side of the unit stopped also. The troubleshoot guide suggested a cold boot of the TV, which we did. All came back, the side control know, and the remote. So if you experience that, cold boot the machine. It's been fine since, so sa far so good.Picture quality is very nice on coax cable connection(don't have HD yet). Integration is pretty nifty with online services while you watch TV. My son is very pleased. It is a nifty little device. I plan on getting another for my wife's bedroom (it's hers, I am just allowed to use it LOL)

Reviews.Title: Internet and more
Reviews.Author: serioiusone
Reviews.Content: This tv offers great tv picture, plus limited internet options. It does not have a full browser, but you can get movies immediately... a very nic feature.

Reviews.Title: Good monitor
Reviews.Author: Clem
Reviews.Content: I like this monitor for the right size, good colors and features that I found that was not on other monitors.

Reviews.Title: Junk, sound distorts picture
Reviews.Author: BillN
Reviews.Content: When the volume is at a normal listening level, any sounds made also shows up on the picture as a series of horizontal distorting blurs, covering the entire screen.  So we have to watch at lower than normal volumes (lower than 50% of maximum) to avoid seeing these distortions (which still show up when any loud noises are made).I thought at first this may have been a problem with the satellite receiver, so unfortunately I did not return this when I had the chance (was just way too busy at the time to deal with yet another tech issue).  But by now the TV has been set up with three different satellite boxes, so it is clearly the TV that is the problem.  This thing NEVER worked right.Will never buy a Vizio again.

Reviews.Title: 21/2 yrs old quit working
Reviews.Author: Kathleen Mater
Reviews.Content: Originally I liked this TV.  It was great for the bedroom.  Now, it's quit working.  After only 21/2 yrs, this isn't acceptable. I've tried all the reboots, resets, etc.  The info online says it won't be cost effective to fix.  The replacement TV won't be a Vizio.

Reviews.Title: Vizio 22-inch LED LCD TV with VIA Internet
Reviews.Author: JSF
Reviews.Content: It has been performing well mostly.  There were a few times where the streaming had some problems, but it couldbe due to my internet service.

Reviews.Title: tv was broken
Reviews.Author: Chase martin
Reviews.Content: The tv was broken so I got a refund but all I really wanted was the tv....but they were out of stock. So my wife did not get that christmas present

Reviews.Title: This tv sucks
Reviews.Author: jon doe
Reviews.Content: I've owned this tv for exactly 2 years and it has quit working. It will cost more to have it fixed then to replace it,Vizio's customer service sucks.

Reviews.Title: No Wall mount but good picture
Reviews.Author: Mark T
Reviews.Content: Good picture but does not have wall mount holes on back of monitor.  So if you plan to mount on wall this one is not setup with mount points on back.

Reviews.Title: Good TV not the best monitor.
Reviews.Author: Gary Sims
Reviews.Content: I use this on my personal desk top for a monitor and can not run at 1080p to keep my start menu on the page. when used as a TV the picture is very good.

Reviews.Title: Nice small but Smart TV
Reviews.Author: TG
Reviews.Content: Great small smart TV.  We put in our spare bedroom for our guests and its also perfect to watch when using the treadmill.  Netflix and all the rest of the services work just fine.  Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: A reliable device for patient people
Reviews.Author: PopeBrain
Reviews.Content: This is the only smart TV I have ever owned or used.  I use it a lot.  We are Netflix and Amazon Prime users, so those apps are key.The device is brutally slow and painful to navigate.  However, it never fails to deliver the content.  It requires the occasional power cycle if you restart an app too quickly, but mostly it's operator error compounded by poor software - so avoidable.  Ultimately it's been 100% reliable given a few minutes of patience.

Reviews.Title: I recommend it!
Reviews.Author: JL
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for about 2 years, and it has worked well. The Netflix streaming feature is great!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Clay
Reviews.Content: I absolutely LOVE this TV, replaced an old 2005 HD TV, graphics are unbeatable, love it I recomend it to anyone

Reviews.Title: save your money
Reviews.Author: retired veteran
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv 2 years ago. It is broken now. I will not buy the same brand ever again.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Tom"
Reviews.Content: I meant to write this sometime ago. I bought this as a gift to my sister who is taking care of my mother,. She was THRILLED I set it up for her and it is the best thing for her!!!  Thank you for a great deal and letting me make someone feel special

Reviews.Title: Good for a small desk monitor/TV!
Reviews.Author: Shawn Castle
Reviews.Content: I got this for my small desk, and the quality is perfect.  I had to mess with the color settings, the sharpness especially, so I could make the print on the screen as fine and easy to read as possible, but after I did that I used it as my main computer monitor.  I upgraded to a larger Vizio screen, which I love as well.I still use this as my second screen so I can use it to view files or watch things while using the other screen for something else.  But very nice screen!

Reviews.Title: We love this TV
Reviews.Author: Zachary White
Reviews.Content: Bought this for the bedroom.  We're not a bigger is better family so this is the perfect size.  Sits nicely on the dresser and the picture is nice.  Overall a little on the dark side but still a nice picture.  Pretty much use it for just Netflix and offf-air channels. Netflix app is sweet.  Blown away by the value.

It works good. Sound and picture quality tilted could be better. ROKU interface and hardware has better apps. Otherwise, for the price, can't complain.

Reviews.Title: Nice, but tinny sound and awful remote control
Reviews.Author: Peter Pisciotta "Peter P"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my boat so I could stream Netflix movies (no cable TV) - was the smallest WiFi streaming TV I could locate for a reasonable price. WiFi works fine, picture is fine, only complaints are the sound is pretty bad (tinny), and Vizio remote controls are just plain awful - no backlight, button labels are very small and difficult to read.

Reviews.Title: VIZIO TV
Reviews.Author: Cathy C.
Reviews.Content: I love this VIZIO 22-inch TV. It's the perfect size for my bedroom, great picture quality and easy to connect to the Internet. Granted the sound is not very good but I it's okay with headphones.

Reviews.Title: lovin it!
Reviews.Author: Amy "homesteadblessings"
Reviews.Content: We got this tv and so far we love love love it!impressions:Wifi: The wifi connection is great. Flawless and simple to set up.Picture quality: Awesome and clear. Hooked up an antenna and get several channels all crisp and clear.Size: It is what it is! It is a small tv but that is what we needed.Sound: The only downer as everyone says is the sound but we hooked up an old pair of computer speakers with a sub woofer and it is like we are in a theater.Overall love it and will be buying the same tv in a 36" for the living room :0)

Reviews.Title: Utah Customer Service Tech was Horrible
Reviews.Author: LanaH
Reviews.Content: This TV is 3 years old and it keeps turning off and on and after talking with customer service, I'd have to say I had one of the worst experiences I've ever had.  Based in Utah, this representative was nonchalant and indifferent.  He basically said, the TV is out of warranty so tough luck.  I understand that if your tech is out of warranty, there's not much customer service can do, but I don't expect a crappy attitude.I don't know about other shoppers, but I don't have the money to buy tech every 2-3 years.  I would think long and hard before buying this TV - if customer service is needed at some point the last thing you'd need is to deal with some horrible customer service rep that would rather be home than dealing with customers.

Reviews.Title: Wow
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I mean, WOW!!!!I gotta tell you, I spent the whole year checking those 42 & 47 inches TV with internet applications mainly cause I wanted the options of having something to watch other than what they're showing on cable, but I couldn't afford those 42" prices, this is the perfect option.  If you want to surf the internet you'll think this has not so many applications but for the price this is the best thing ever.  You get internet radio (pandora, Tune Radio, etc), you get Netflix streamed directly to the TV, without the need of running wires, you get Yahoo News (sports, finance, etc), It's the best thing at an affordable price.  I'm extremely happy with this product.  Highly recommended.No problems with the TV at all, volume is OK, It is, you don't need the TV to replace your home theater equipment.  I read some comments before and thought that was going to be an issue, but hey, it's a TV, and sound for TV is just perfect.

Reviews.Title: great tv to watch netflix, very light and energy efficient!
Reviews.Author: "Ben"
Reviews.Content: i got this set at target because our old 26" lcd broke down. It starts a little slow because of the app OS, but still faster than our old polaroid. We pretty much decided on this particular model because it had netflix on it (which we started using just 2 months ago) and offered 1080p in a small package. The only problem is that it is hard to read small text at 10 ft away; wish it had a way to zoom text like browsers do. Also the nob that turns it on is somewhat of a mystery to use, and makes it hard to turn off, so i only use the remote to turn on/off. The vcr buttons don't work with my dvd player/recoder when using HDMI, but couldn't even find a function to detect appliances attached to HDMI inputs. Netflix streaming works great on this set through wifi connection. Being able to listen to local radio using a widget is easier than struggling to get a station with good reception on a regular radio.

Reviews.Title: NICE TV
Reviews.Author: Kevin Stock "Gadget Guy"
Reviews.Content: Very nice TV in all respects save one, thus the 4 stars.  If the speakers were better it would be 5 stars plus.  Not a showstopper and I realize the price, but even at this price the sound could be better.  All in all a phenomenal value!

Reviews.Title: Great TV, shame about the WiFi ...
Reviews.Author: albrandwood "albrandwood"
Reviews.Content: I'm not going to cover the functionality of the TV itself, just posting to help those who can not get it to work on their wifi network:This TV is *NOT* officially Wi-Fi certified ... It is Wi-Fi compatible ... As long as you don't mind relatively poor (but "adequate") network security. You can use Wi-Fi as long as your network encryption follows three simple rules...1) no more than 10 characters within the wifi personal key. ( Apparently, their technicians "read" that 10 characters was as secure as 63 ... )2) does not allow non-alphanumeric characters.... ( Contrary to WPA2 specifications. )3) does not accept HEX, only ASCII keys ( Shame the on-screen keyboard does not conform to rule (2) above :) )Or, put another way: No punctuation, no spaces, no special characters, and ONLY 10 characters ...Fortunately, Vizio does not advertise the TV as Wi-Fi Certified, only Wi-Fi Compatible.PS: Why no DLNA ability???

Reviews.Title: Great little wifi tv
Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a small TV to mount in front of my treadmill to make my walks a little more enjoyable. My treadmill is in my office and I didn't want to put a receiver in there so I was looking for something that would work with Netflix. This fit the bill perfectly. It's the perfect size and the Netflix app is fantastic. It's very lightweight and sleek looking. The picture quality is fantastic. Some have complained about the sound quality but it hasn't been a problem for me sice I'm standing right in front of it. The best sound quality for any TV is to hook it up with a surround sound system or stereo anyway and if I were using it for any other purpose that is exactly what I would do. I have been extremely happy with this TV. I really haven't used any of the other apps since I really only needed it for Netflix so I can't really comment on them. But if you are looking for a small, lightweight, good looking TV with wifi and Netflix, this is the one.

Reviews.Title: Great tv for the prize
Reviews.Author: omds
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv for my kids.  They love it and so do I.  It has some of the most popular internet apps like Netflix and Blockbuster and they have been great for both the kids and I.  I've had the tv for a month with zero issues.

Reviews.Title: Well worth it!!!
Reviews.Author: amazoniac
Reviews.Content: Works great. I have been really impressed with this TV. My wife and I purchased this television to replace our old tube TV in our bedroom. Since we do not have a satellite connection in there, the Netflix app gives us plenty to watch. Great product. Great price.

Reviews.Title: Vizio fits the bill.
Reviews.Author: Conchetta Luzerne
Reviews.Content: I wanted a TV for my kitchen counter and since I already own the VIZIO XVT553SV w/ wifi and LOVE it, I thought I'd go with its 22" baby brother.The picture is great and the set up was very easy.Lightweight with a bright and crisp display.The no-glare matte screen is great in my sunny kitchen.I've tried connecting it with both a cable and an antenna hook-up...the reception is great either way.This is the 2nd VIZIO in my home and have not been disappointed with either, both were a super value (bought the 55" on Black Friday last year)...so I believe I'll stick with this brand.FYI...My previous brand loyalty belonged to Sony, but as I needed to look for both quality and cost due to finances...Vizio fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: Nice Product for the price
Reviews.Author: NKOST
Reviews.Content: Product arrived in just a few days even though I used standard free shipping. (excellent!  The tv arrived in the original packaging and was undamaged. It comes with some cabling (component video to (VGA RGB) adapter, power cables etc...The screen is matte (not glossy) which is a plus as it reduces any glare from bright windows or lights in the the room.  I was impressed with how versatile this tv is for connecting up to various sources... HDMI(2) RF ant input, Ethernet, etc..I immediately tested the ATSC tuner with my 13' Yagi Boom outdoor antenna. I got 33 out of the 35 available digital channels in my area on the 1st scan. (not bad at all!)Picture quality is very good.. (not videophile grade but still very good).  Its got loads of adjustments so you can tweak it if you feel the need.  The remote is plain but functions. (doesn't have any FOO FOO ergonomicly placed backlighted buttons or anything fancy) The sound quality is poor. (sounds like an old transistor radio) butits a 22" ultrathin monitor...(what do you expect?) The sound isactually better than average for tiny monitor speakers but stillvery tinny.I used a wired connection for ethernet.. got right into netflix. (thats the only internet streaming service I use so far)I am very pleased with this set so far.  If your thinking about buying this set DO IT!  It really does offer good value for theprice.  This tv is great for a bedroom, kitchen, or any where thata 2nd small tv is needed...November 29th update: Tv still working good. I like it so much I wanted to buy another one and maybe take advantage of black friday deals... but now this set is priced approx $60 higher than what I paid for it on Oct 5th.. (I thought Nov 25th thru dec 31st is supposed to be the time for the best prices?)  Looks like I'm gonna have to spend my cash elsewhere for now... (unless Amazon can give us another sub $240 price)Cmon amazon... make my day!

Reviews.Title: Worked perfectly, easy set-up.
Reviews.Author: William L.
Reviews.Content: We just needed a TV with wifi for our work out room and this a an quick easy way to get that done.  The picture is great and the set up is very easy.  This is my 2nd VIZIO and believe they are a good value.

Reviews.Title: Good small TV
Reviews.Author: Ready to go
Reviews.Content: It is a very good product. The only negative part is the sound. Compared to other TVs it leaves something to be desired.

Reviews.Title: Good TV with really good sound.
Reviews.Author: Z Reader
Reviews.Content: The only problem was that I had to buy a separate mounting part to be able to mount it on a standard VESA 10x10 plate.This wasn't clear in the description and wasn't supplied. It cost about $20 with shipping. This was rather confusing to me and to their technical support people.Finally they told me that I had to buy it separately and connected me to their parts dept. After that all went well.It has really good picture and great sound for the size.

Reviews.Title: I love my vizio!
Reviews.Author: Natalie Alva "We live on a star"
Reviews.Content: This great tv is just perfect!  The wifi is inmediately connected after entering your wifi account information.  Crystal clear image and easy navigation.  Thank you Vizio!  Better than I expected!

Reviews.Title: poor remote
Reviews.Author: benz
Reviews.Content: Nice LED TV, great picture, easy set up, small TV sound, TV response to remote very slow. I would recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Great Wireless Connectivity and Internet Apps!
Reviews.Author: JMM
Reviews.Content: My review is specific to the wonderful internet features/apps on this TV.  The set comes pre-configured for wireless connectivity - if you have a router in your home this TV will be able to access the internet - the setup process is very quick and easy.I purchased this to watch TV while I am exercising on the treadmill.  The 22" screen is the perfect size (I am about 3 feet away from the screen).  The $220 price tag on this TV is well worth it for the quality... and the fact that I am more likely to exercise now!Here are the Internet Video Apps that this TV supports and that I am currently using:- Netflix: currently $7.99 a month - A wide selection of movies and television shows, commercial free.  Unlimited streaming.- Hulu Plus: currently $7.99 a month - A lot of great new television content.  You can watch many TV shows the day after they air.  Unlimited streaming.- Amazon Instant Video: You pay per title, and can either buy or rent.  To get you started, Amazon is currently offering a $5 credit when you link this TV to the Amazon Instant Video app.It is very easy to link your TV to your existing video subscription accounts.  It is also very convenient that the TV keeps you logged in to these services... you don't have to sign in each time you turn the TV on.  Video Quality on all of the above services is great when watching on this TV, and loading times are typically fast (will depend on your internet connection).A note about video search/selection:  The remote does not have any keys for letters, this makes searching for movies/TV shows by name very difficult and it can get frustrating.  I would recommend that if you are planning on using this TV with one of the video services listed above, put all videos into your queue/favorites list.  That way when you go to use the TV, the videos you want to watch are already right there for easy access.

Reviews.Title: Good kitchen HDTV
Reviews.Author: Harry "house husband"
Reviews.Content: We bought this Vizio HDTV knowing that it had poor sound quality. We use it to view news, sports and other programs on our kitchen counter-top where good sound is not a must. When viewing movies, musicals and similar programs requiring good sound, we use our larger HDTVs in our other rooms. For our purposes, this 22" Vizio was an excellent buy.

Reviews.Title: OVERALL: a very good tv.
Reviews.Author: P. Garcia "HomeStudio"
Reviews.Content: This is a very good tv for a small bedroom or kitchen. It got plenty of features, VIA Apps are really kool, I love the fact that I can play with pandora :D. Picture quality is really good... sound.. well u better hook some speakers.. It's a really good looking device... cant beat the price for all the features that you get.

Reviews.Title: All in one monitor
Reviews.Author: Michael Lopez "iXplore"
Reviews.Content: OMG, it does everything.  TV with digital decoder, PC monitor, USB drive navigation for pictures and music and then the VIA internet apps.  Wifi and LAN input.  Easy navigation menu.  Autosensing inputs.  Folks, it just doesn't get much better than this.  Get two so you have one to give to a friend.  What's missing - webcam with microphone so you can Skype directly through VIA interface.  Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: Does what you need it to
Reviews.Author: devzin98
Reviews.Content: Let's be honest.  You're not getting a TV this tiny as the cornerstone of your home entertainment center.  You're probably buying it for the kitchen, the kids' room, etc.  For these purposes, it does a fine job and offers a more comprehensive package of "extras" than other TVs in its class.The wireless internet connection is excellent, and Netflix works seamlessly.  The picture itself isn't the best I've seen at this size, but it's still very good.  Those are the pros.The cons - Sound quality is pretty bad, channel changing is SLOW if you're connecting your coax directly to the TV (rather than an external box), and the remote control has soft buttons that don't seem to "connect" with the TV each time they're pressed.  However, that could just be the slow lag of the TV itself, as I stated before.Despite the cons, this TV does what it's meant to do, and is fine for casual "sometimes" use.  We use it in the baby's room, and it's great to be able to watch Netflix while feeding or trying to put him to bed.  Just don't expect too much, and you'll be happy.

Reviews.Title: Internet TV
Reviews.Author: lana, Dre "lanaD"
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these TV for my girls room and they love them. They connect to the internet super easy and my Five year old can watch Netflix movies without help.  There is also a parent control which makes it even better. Only down side there are no buttons on the TV so if you lose your remote you are in trouble.

Reviews.Title: Great TV in a Small Package
Reviews.Author: Highland Rob
Reviews.Content: This TV is worth every penny and is an outstanding choice for a bedroom or kitchen.  The picture is exceptional for such a small TV; it's as good as my Samsung 50" plasma.  The color is superb and the clarity is where it should be for a 1080p LCD, excellent.  (I use a chimney mounted antenna for all my TVs)What makes this TV stand out (besides the great picture) are the internet apps.  There are plenty to choose from and it has all the standards such as Netflix, Pandora, Hulu and even Amazon Instant Video, to name a few.  Wi-Fi setup was a breeze and I was streaming to the TV in less than 30 minutes from the time I opened the box.The only negative is the sound.  As others have stated, it's bad!  You can't expect great sound from such a small TV and I knew this.  There's not much you can do about it either except attach external speakers but due to space limitations, this is not an option for me.  I'll just have to get used to it.  What I don't understand are the other reviewers who were expecting Bose quality sound out of it, what were they thinking they were going to get??All in all I am very pleased with my purchase.  I've heard Vizio was making really good TV's and now I can see it was true.  The picture quality, the most important factor in judging a TV, will astonish you.  The internet apps make this TV an exceptional value and as long as you aren't expecting great sound, you will be happy with your purchase.  Enjoy your new TV.

Reviews.Title: Netflix problem cause tv to not work
Reviews.Author: Shuritta
Reviews.Content: I brought this tv because I've went cable-free and now enjoy basic tv along with Netflix & Hulu so I thought this tv would be great for the bedroom. After the second day I noticed the loading error for Netflix and some other apps caused the tv menu to not work, so I decided it would be better to keep the two separate. I then just brought a non Internet HDTV and the new roku box.

Reviews.Title: No USB Video
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: While the wireless interface is good, this TV won't let you plug in a USB drive for videos. It plays music and shows pictures, but no video.

Reviews.Title: Great purchase
Reviews.Author: Guillermo Gonzalez
Reviews.Content: TV was a great choice for the home office/guest room. I can use it as TV for guests and as a monitor for my computer. Love the wireless functionality as I can download Netflix movies for my kids just with the click of a button. Can also listen to Pandora. It took me a while to figure out how to use with my computer. you have to lower the resolution in your computer and then it will work with RGB (not the Comp RGB but the regular one). Sounds is not the greatest but it's pretty decent for this size. Remote is ok for my needs. Others had a problem with it but it works well.

Reviews.Title: VIZIO VISION...Does the Job
Reviews.Author: Tarot Teacher
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to give this TV 3 1/2 stars and wish there were fractional ratings.  In my opinion the  Vizio is definitely better than a three but not quite so good as a four.  Why?Well, first of all the remote control is tremendously frustrating.  Remotes have been around for decades now and one would think that Vizio could have come up with something a little more sensitive than the clunker they include with the beautiful TV.  And it is a little beauty.Second reason for the half-star is the color adjustablity issue.  Adjustment is done on-screen, of course, and with the remote, which is no doubt part of the problem.  There are a myriad of choices for the color and it literally took me days to come up with a combo that actually looks natural and that I don't have to continually tweak to avoid blue grass and yellow skies.  I must say, though, that once resolved, the picture I get is great.Now, for the good stuff.  I really do love this guy despite his wicked stepmother of a remote.  It LOOKS good and is light weight enough (I have the 22 inch model) to just pick up and move to another room if I want.  That could also be a drawback if there are young children or rambunctious pets around...it could easily be knocked over...it is very light weight. However, it does come with a wall-mount gadget if you want to keep it in one place.  I got this for the computer area of my family room but use it more in the bedroom as it turns out.Finally, why have a TV if the picture isn't any good...I think the quality is excellent for this compact little set at a very compact and affordable price.  The sound could be a bit better but is tolerable with lots of room for volume adjustment.  Bottom line is I am very happy with my purchase.  It arrived a day early, the directions are totally easy to understand, assembly requires NO tools and is a dream (just putting the set on the stand) and set up amounts to plugging it in and letting it find your wireless connection.  If it weren't for that remote from the Dark Ages I'd give this an easy 4-star rating.

Reviews.Title: Awesome buy!!!
Reviews.Author: Cyndal
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my Sons room, I needed something that he could watch Netflix shows, like Dora on.  Since he is young I also looked at fun TV's like ones in the shape of cool cartoons, but instead I decided on this because I figured he won't grow out of it.  If he's 10 or 18 it's still cool, he will be able to take it with him to college ect.  It works great, sometimes the Netflix is a little slow loading but video playback is awesome,and the sound quality is great for it's size.  I am very happy with this purchase!  I want one for myself!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Christina Barnes "Amazon Shopper"
Reviews.Content: This tv will change how you watch television. I have so much with the apps. The only crticism is that I wish there were more apps to choose from and that if you have a NetGear Router you may be in trouble.

Reviews.Title: great little TV
Reviews.Author: Mickey R. Bailey "mrbailey10"
Reviews.Content: Purchased this to replace an ancient VCR-TV combo, adding to my bedroom.  Quickly assembed the base to chasis without tools.  It very quickly connected to my WiFi, much faster than my iMAC.  As others stated, the sound is small and tinny, but who wants home theatre in the bedroom?Video is awesome, brings life to my U-Verse system.  The apps and widgets add a new dimension to viewing.My first VIZIO product, time will tell how this holds up.

Reviews.Title: Good Overall--Excellent Internet Apps
Reviews.Author: Eric Rook
Reviews.Content: The TV is good but when I connected it to my Macbook Pro via a VGA connection it only supported 1024x768 screen resolution. Tech support said that if you use the HDMI adapter then it would support the full 1920X1080 screen resolution. The TV also has a low display brightness even at the highest brightness level. The Vizio internet apps are awesome. I use Netflix on this TV and it's great.

Reviews.Title: Great but keyboard would be nice
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer "NT"
Reviews.Content: It's a great product. The only thing that keeps it from getting a 5 star rating is that it lacks a keyboard. Navigation with a traditional remote is a pain. Otherwise, it's great and I'm saving a few dollars everything month by canceling my cable service.

Reviews.Title: nice
Reviews.Author: Karla Cecilia Lemus
Reviews.Content: nice tv overall. i bought it for my mom's room. With a small antenna it picked up local channels. it was a bit bigger than i expected but it does not take up much space, really kool and the price was nice as well. I see streming movies the tv pickd up the signal from my router quickly :)

Reviews.Title: does its job, slow channel switching though
Reviews.Author: A. Jain "Bookoholic"
Reviews.Content: I just bought it for small guest room. Got it for $250 at Target.com.I was however disappointed with the Internet apps that it does not have youtube option. However our primary purpose was Netflix which it plays great.Sound is not bad for small room, some people seem to complain about it. Also TV channel switching is very slow compared to other LCD TVs.

Reviews.Title: TERRIBLE TV... Maybe I got a Lemon... Shrugs
Reviews.Author: D. Nguyen "Secret Asian Man 007"
Reviews.Content: First off, I like to consider myself a tech savvy guy.  I am the person who set ups, fixes, troubleshoots technological problems in my household.  I love electronics and I always get them to work.With that being said, I purchased this TV for my girlfriend.  We were planning to take this to her apartment so she can watch TV during those "breaks between studying".  When the TV arrived, I attempted to connect the TV to the internet.  The TV was able to recognize the wireless internet connection.  After entering the password, the TV was unable to connect.  I confirmed the password was correct by using an my Apple iTouch to wirelessly connect.  Then I attempted to connect this TV with a wired Ethernet cable plugged directly into my router.  When I select the "wired ethernet connection" option on the TV, it just refreshes the WIRELESS internet networks.  WTF????  I didn't click the refresh button!I googled this issue and it appears to be a common problem with Vizio VIA HDTVs.  I read another review on amazon and an unfortunate buyer had the same issue.  I also read other reviews where Vizio customer service/technical support blamed the issue on the router, the wires, power source etc.  **shakes head**  Really Vizio?!?!?  I have seen youtube videos of frustrated users videotaping their Vizio TVs to prove to the Vizio technical support that their problems were real.  After seeing all these dissatisfied customers, I decided to return this TV.  I didn't even bother to try calling Vizio the following morning and risk them saying it's my router.  I wasted a good 3-4 hours attempted to get this junk to work.  I also saw SUPER frustrated customers run their Vizio TVs over with their truck.  That was quite amusing since I shared the same frustration.I learned my lesson, I should have gone with Samsung.  I had three Samsungs and they work flawlessly.  I will never purchase a Vizio TV again.  I guess you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: Awsome little TV BUT BEWARE!
Reviews.Author: TechGeek
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with the picture quality of this little thing.  The internet capabilities and features were exactly what we needed for our excercise room.  The wifi was a cinch to set up.  The Pandora and Netflix were great once the TV updated itself.  The speakers on the TV didn't even work when I got to my house (I bought it used from seller off amazon, so be careful buying used) but it dossen't sound like I'm missing out on much.  BUYER BEWARE:  You cannot use any wall mount on this thing besides Vizio's own that's has the adapter plate.  It says it has a 100mm VESA pattern, NONEXISTANT!  I had to cut and grind down and drill new holes to fit this specific TV, very frustrating.  I called Vizio and asked if they just sold the specific adapter plate for it, and they told me no I would have to buy the whole mount itself for $109.  That wasn't going to happen.  So if you want to wall mount, prepare to shell out or spend and afternoon getting your mounting plate to be able to fit.  But like I said before, the TV itself is a great package, with just one major design flaw.

Reviews.Title: Not exactly as advertised
Reviews.Author: Irritated
Reviews.Content: First, the good- picture is great, internet access is good and most of the widgets work well.My main complaints:Can't connect to a DLNA or upnp server- no widgets, apps, etc. Just no way to do it.USB port- limited to FAT32, which is idiotic considering the file size limitation on FAT32. When apps are developed that WILL play movies from usb media this will really limit your options.Finally, no media player for USB (see comment above about FAT32)Tech support was not great - person I spoke with did not know what a dlna server was.

Reviews.Title: OK TV - Terrible, frustrating  remote
Reviews.Author: Not Me
Reviews.Content: The TV is OK for a TV.  Setting up the wireless conncetion is difficult.  I haven't connected yet, so cannot comment on the APPS.  I can see my connection, in setup but cannot access it (I only have access my neighbours).,The remote IS THE WORST.  The enter button (in the center of the control buttons) is so small, I often end up duplicating characters.  It is tedious to navigate around the virtual "keyboard".  If you make a mistake you have to navigate to the delete button.  Since the Enter button is so small when you enter a wrong character, and you will, or omit one (you cannot goto that spot an enter it) you have to go to the delete button and then back to typing.It would be nice to have a larger Enter button and a delete button on the remote, rather than at the furthest corner on the keyboard.I really HATE the remote.If I had to do it again I'd probably go for a Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Good Specifications and Features, Quality Questionable.
Reviews.Author: xephael
Reviews.Content: This TV uses yahoo widgets for netflix and other Internet enabled applications [...].  The Yahoo connected TV interface is not exactly snappy but it does work fairly well.I bought this LED TV as a factory refurbished device so it should have been fully updated with the newest firmware, and had the hardware thoroughly tested.  Unfortunately many of the features listed in the manual such as Bluetooth, Audio Equalizer, etc are missing from the system settings interface.  Additionally there was no option available to upgrade the firmware from any of the menus.  According to the manual on Vizio's website the TV automatically updates itself over the Internet.  This never happened with the model I had, and the system had this firmware installed on it for the three days I used the TV: vizio_c1.2.22_rcI'm returning the this TV because when the volume is turned up past 60 to 95 QAM digital channels will drop out and skip.  I believe the tuner is not sufficiently protected from electromagnetic interference from the internal speakers.

Reviews.Title: Wi fi TV
Reviews.Author: Frederick Melean
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV. The wi fi works great and is very easy to connect. A great TV for a low price.

Reviews.Title: excellent for price
Reviews.Author: jeremiah reed
Reviews.Content: i have owned this for a year now never have any problems with it with the size we use it in the bedroom and its fantastic you cant go wrong with this purchase at $200 or less

Reviews.Title: Just what I needed
Reviews.Author: Barbi
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a small tv and liked this one because it works well with my wireless network. As noted by others, the sound is just okay but I didn't expect great sound from this TV. Picture is good and, having owned and used this TV occasionally for the past month or so, am happy to report I have not had any problems.

Reviews.Title: Good TV
Reviews.Author: Seascape
Reviews.Content: Very happy with this TV. Only used it to watch TV--no games etc. No complaints except for the tinny sound which is pretty standard on comparable TV sizes & prices. But we did get used to the tinny sound. For anything other than a main/living room TV it's a great choice. Apparently the thieves who robbed our cottage and stole this TV thought so too (nothing else stolen, not even our other 2 older fat-back TV's)! Replacing with another Vizio, a 24" size that costs less.

Reviews.Title: Vizio 22" WiFi LED/LCD TV
Reviews.Author: Jett
Reviews.Content: This TV is awesome! Purchased at a great price, picture is beautiful, sound is excellent and plenty loud, WiFi works great, TV has some Apps already pre-loaded. What more could you ask for. Highly recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Internet Capability
Reviews.Author: d. d. reyn
Reviews.Content: Beautiful picture, smart user interface, really smart internet capability. We have this TV in the forest in middle Minnesota connected to Direct TV; and we use the TV's wireless capability to connect to DSL to bring in Netflix. Love it! Update: we bought another exact same TV for our home in Hawaii and are very pleased with the sound and picture - and, of course, using it to view Netflix movies. And we use it wirelessly!

Reviews.Title: VIZIO M221NV 22-Inch Full HD 1080p LED LCD Monitor
Reviews.Author: Garreth
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to try a new brand that I had never used previously, but I know a number of people that had purchased Vizio products and were happy with them.  Well, Vizio has been upheld its reputation.  It has performed flawlessly and is still serving me well.  I recommend Vizio to anyone who wants a solid performing monitor on their desk!

Reviews.Title: Very nice for gaming
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv primarily to game on and believe me the picture is CRYSTAL CLEAR I am very happy with my purchase and I am 16 so if your looking for a good tv that has excellent picture and don't mind paying a bit more this tv is perfect I think it's worth the money cause if u buy other tvs that are less expensive u save a bit of money but I don't think it's worth it I'd rather pay a bit more for a quality item that will last me years than buy a cheaper tv that will start having problems down the road overall very good FPS is fast no lag between controller and tv I play battlefield in close qaurters and need the tv to be very responsive and this tv does the trick I am always MVP when I play so I definitely recommend this. The tv remote is ok not that bad it is responsive I don't find my self repeatedly pressing one button cause it doesn't work one con about the remote would prob be that it has no backlighting so in the dark u can't see buttons but not a big deal for me because I have this tv on my office desk. So if u your looking to purchase a quality tv for either gaming or for watching blue ray movies and tv shows in full 1080p quality I definitely recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: The best
Reviews.Author: Marcoz C "MC"
Reviews.Content: well it took me a while to post a review,i have this 22 inch as a monitor and it looks insane i even took some pics to upload check them out!

Reviews.Title: Good For The Money
Reviews.Author: Skeetersmom
Reviews.Content: I had a pretty picky criteria when I was looking for a bedroom television.  I wanted an HDTV ready TV with the availability for using Netflix.  I also wanted a 1080p model with a decent picture with a screen size of 22"-30".  My price range was 200.00-300.00...bingo....THANK YOU AMAZON.  I bought the VIZIO brand for about 319.00 and shipping was free.I found exactly what I wanted!!  The only drawback was the volume it's just okay, but it's fine for a bedroom TV.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic for the kids in the kitchen.
Reviews.Author: reflectionmommy "reflectionmommy"
Reviews.Content: Lots of apps, and they are the popular ones that you would expect- all preinstalled.  Pretty straightforward to hook up and to program, and setup too.  Kids love the easy to use remote, easy navigation from one thing to another, and of course using NetFlix, which is primarily what they do.  It does a lot of great things for us, we have had it up for some time now, and have experienced the cool, the strange, and the "just the way it is, but thumbs up", of it all.Before I start, I would say we would buy this again.  It just surprised me on some notes, but, after some getting used to it, we now like the things that at first gave us pause.  Mostly.Bad speakers.  But, this is for the kids, and the sound doesn't carry into the living room like it used to with the old tv.  It stays more concentrated within that room, and although it is tinny sounding, it is heavy on the voices, and disproportionately light on any other sounds on anything you may want to watch.  We now realize that we like that.Finicky, to be sure.  When switching from an app, like NetFlix, to watch shows from the DVR in the living room which it is hard-wired to, it seems to take an awful long time, or, it may even restart itself, or turn off.  Not a big deal, just hope that it gets no more freaky than it already is.  Picture is great, considering it is small, and is chock full of all kinds of gear to do that job.  I have to admit, I spent an hour and a half, trying different settings, picture and volume controls, checking for firmware updates, etc., was worried as I worked on it, but we like it now.I am positive, seeing what was out to be purchased at the CES this year, that this all in one, all capable tv (with many more features than what this has currently), will be the trend for all tv's to come.A really great purchase, that the kids are super happy with, all with less sound leakage into the living room for Mom and Dad.  Would buy again.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, nice widgets, sound is okay
Reviews.Author: esek
Reviews.Content: This TV has been a wonderful upgrade for our bedroom TV. The Netflix and Pandora apps are great, but I'm not sure what other apps I'll really use. The wifi streaming over 802.11n is fast and smooth for Netflix. Watching Tron:Legacy was impressive, and the interface made navigating through the movie very easy.As for sound, what do you expect sound-wise from a TV that is this thin? It's perfectly fine for our bedroom. If we want better, we'll get a cheap 2.1 or 5.1 sound system.As for the VESA wall/arm mounting system, it does add an inch or two of depth because of the bracket you need to attach. This is because all the inputs and outputs are at the center of the back of the TV where it attaches so it must be spaced out to allow space for the cables. Works just fine for our swing arm mount but it's not exactly sleek.The backlight control options are numerous, but I'm not sure how helpful the automatic backlight adjustment really is.The firmware upgraded within a day of connecting the system, and after the initial boot-up it doesn't take too long to come on.Considering we kept our previous 15" Element TV for 4+ years, I'm sure this one will last even longer. Thanks, Vizio! I hope this TV lasts and makes me a convert.[EDIT 1/12/12]Firmware has updated one or two more times, automatically. Everything is still working great and we're loving this TV!

Reviews.Title: It is a great TV
Reviews.Author: Bob Lane
Reviews.Content: It is wonderful actually I took it with on a trip it is sturdy and flexible.My family and I enjoy watching movies on it. It is bigger than trying to watch them on a computer. The sound is also good.

Reviews.Title: Vizio M221NV Led TV
Reviews.Author: BigBob
Reviews.Content: Bought this tv after doing a lot of searching thru the reviews. Product is above average. Shipping was very good. The product was put in service with minimal effort and additional apps. were downloaded to the device to personalize it.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for gaming!
Reviews.Author: E. Stevenson "Heavy Metal Librarian"
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace my old 26" Olevia. This is a great television for gaming with its 1080p resolution. The television is very slim and very light--8 pounds! However, it's so called component inputs are handled through the VGA connection (Component -> VGA connector) so you can't use both at same time. Good thing it gives a RCA splitter for connection the component RCA plugs. The screen is very nice. My only problem so far is a lack of Hulu Plus because the television didn't have the current firmware update. I learned that the television updates itself when it's off and there's no way to manually do it yourself when the TV is on. The speakers are alright, but nothing special (I thought SRS speakers are supposed to be good).For anime fans, there's Crunchyroll, but it's limited (no Premium login, so no simulcasts on the day they come out--you have to wait a week). Still the CR quality is good.ProsInternet Apps - Amazon on Demand, Hulu Plus, Netflix, Blockbuster, VUDU, Tunein, Pandora, Crunchyroll...Internet reception on screen. Good idea--it helps with positioning the TV to get the best reception1080p resolutionSlim and light!Sound limiter...no more loud commercials.Auto brightness control.ConsSound is okay.Apps sometimes crash. This might a reception problem.Firmware updates have to be done when the TV is off, no doing it yourself.

Reviews.Title: nice little TV
Reviews.Author: msVickiFlorida "MsVicki"
Reviews.Content: Easy to hook up to the internet; recognized Netflix and other apps instantly. Works great. Nice picture. Very good buy. Using it in the bedroom.

Reviews.Title: Great little internet TV
Reviews.Author: Craig Dokken
Reviews.Content: Received TV set, and set it up in 40 minutes, setup Netflex and wireless. Worked first time. Nice little TV. This is the first VIZIO brand item I have bought, so far it has worked well.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: zach
Reviews.Content: 1080P resolution with 2 HDMI ports,and integrated WiFi makes this LED-LCD one of the best on the market. Incredibly sleek, very portable, perfect for gaming. Buy it!

Reviews.Title: Great little wifi hdtv
Reviews.Author: MikeN
Reviews.Content: I have always been a big name brand guy when it comes to HDTV's. I only buy Samsung LED/LCD's and only Panasonic's plasma's. However after reading all the positive reviews about this tv and the features it had, I decided it was worth buying. Im glad I did because it turns out this tv is pretty darn good. I love the wifi connectivity and internet applications. I use Hulu plus all the time.Most people were griping about the small sounding speakers, but from my experience the sound is quite adequate. The audio does sound a tad muffled, but that is to be expected with a tv of this size. The picture and viewing angles are really good too. The skintones look a little too saturated, but I havent fine-tuned all the picture settings yet.The only drawback, and the reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5: There are no QWERTY remote controls available for this TV.Overall a great wifi HDTV at an amazing price!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: jfazio86
Reviews.Content: I really like this TV! It is everything I need it to be for a bedroom TV. It was really easy to set up and even though the remote sucks I could go buy a different one if it bothered me that much. Definitely am happy with it!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Calll98
Reviews.Content: Very nice and slim design. Nice to look at. The sound could be better, but it is just fine for a smaller room. The interface is easy to work with and quite user-friendly. I wish it had a browser though, that is the one big thing that I see this TV lacking. Other than that, it is a great purchase and overall I am very satisfied with it.

Reviews.Title: 4 out of have 5
Reviews.Author: matt
Reviews.Content: ITs a good tv in many ways but what it is lacking a good mounting system. Its seams cheap. good on Everything else

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Cynthia Barnard
Reviews.Content: Great Tv for the price.  My son uses it for gaming and he is a serious gamer.  He was adament about getting a 1080P, this means nothing to me but he says it is a good thing LOL.  The other great feature is he no longer has to use a roku box or his 360 to stream Netflix.  This TV has that feature built right in... Awesome :)

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: poor richard
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome HDTV.  With the wireless capability and full 1080p it has everything you could possibly need in a TV.  It works with Netflix perfectly. The only down fall is that it is almost to little for the space I have it in.

Reviews.Title: Vizio Internet Apps
Reviews.Author: J-Rod
Reviews.Content: This TV works great. Crisp picture and the built in internet apps are nice which means you don't have to watch movies on computer screen. The one thing I didn't like is that the smaller models don't come with a qwerty keyboard.

Reviews.Title: Happy so far.
Reviews.Author: Samster
Reviews.Content: The television arrived promptly. It was easy to setup and the internet connectivity was pretty much plug and play - found wireless access point quickly and programming the device was completed in minutes.

Reviews.Title: Good deal
Reviews.Author: O. C. Gregg
Reviews.Content: Good price, great picture, Internet apps are easy and nice.  Sound is mediocre at best, so I added a small $40 computer sound system w/ small sub.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: Kari
Reviews.Content: We were looking for something small and simple with Netflix, Amazon, etc for our bedroom. This has been great! Picture and sound are very adequate. The streaming is actually faster than our bigger TV/Blu-ray in the living room. Interface is very easy to use and maneuver through

Reviews.Title: Picture This
Reviews.Author: craftyone
Reviews.Content: This TV is going in our garage in front of our treadmill.  My husband and daughter will love the 30 minute videos while they exercise.  It's small and compact.  Takes up little space and has an excellent picture.  Can be hooked up to the internet for bedroom or other use.

Reviews.Title: Internet apps are great addition
Reviews.Author: Jerad Heffner "geek, car buff, and dad"
Reviews.Content: The VIZIO 22" LED TV with VIZIO Internet Apps (VIA) has been a great addition to our kitchen. We replaced a 13" CRT TV with this one and are very impressed.  The picture quality is excellent; we have it connected to a DISH HD receiver via HDMI.I like everything about it except the following four points:- The sound is tinny.- The speakers are on the back of the TV, causing the sound to bounce off the wall behind it. It's an odd effect, but easy to get used to.- The web apps are awesome, but they are sometimes slow-loading or slow to respond when selecting apps. Our local news station has an app which allows us to see the current temp, tower cams, and news videos at any time. We can also stream Amazon videos (Go Prime!) and Netflix movies, as well as choose from a decent selection of other web sources.- Occasionally we'll get a "NO SIGNAL" error after closing out of a web app. We'll have to power off the TV, wait a few seconds, then power it back on to get the signal to return.I'd like to rate this 4 1/2 stars because I think the exceptions I listed above are either minor or to be expected, but I rated it 4 stars because I don't want to give an impression of perfection by giving it 5 stars.[8-MONTH UPDATE] After using this for 8 months, I wanted to provide an update. I feel my original points are still valid. However, we have not had the no-signal issue lately, which makes me think it was a bad cable.  I will add that if you turn off the TV by accident, it will take about a minute until you're able to turn it back on. I also find that some of the web apps do not allow you to fast forward video, and if you stop the video, you will have to restart the video from the beginning. As such, I retract my in-review 4.5-star rating and set it to 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: good small tv
Reviews.Author: Tampart1 "Tampart1"
Reviews.Content: Great little TV, and works well.  The only problem I have had so far that it is only 60 HZ, but I could not find a small TV that was 120 HZ.  I am used to 240 HZ on my 47 in. Vizio, so to watch a car race, this is not good. Guess I am spoiled by the big TV.  But for most programs it is good.  The internet apps are good and easy to set up. Vizio does provide a good instruction book on this one which is much better than the one I got on my 47 in. 2 years ago. Amazon's price is about the same as Sams, and you get free shipping and no tax, so that was a no brainer.

Reviews.Title: Tradeoffs
Reviews.Author: Dan J
Reviews.Content: This caught my eye as a small but good 1080p set for the money.  I think the picture is good... issues I found were (1) TV is slow on boot... you have basically let it 'boot' each time and it takes time.  Flipping channels is frustrating slow to the impatient (2) remote is a pain... they have the enter button right over the cursor keys and it's not only slow and frustrating to try to move around, but hitting the enter key will usually hit the cursor movement keys at the same time and screw up whatever you are doing (3) I wish this unit had more than one coax input (4) Internet apps are sometimes frustrating, time consuming to figure out and slow to use and really aren't that convenient that I use them much (5) the on/off button/menu selector concept doesn't allow for quick on/off... you have to press the button, scroll down to turn off and then turn off the unit (6) as everyone else says on the sound... forget it.  Speakers/sound are very cheap and tinny and even in a budget set could be done better I think (7)  Wireless took right away once I figured all those setting out and it needed to download and apply updates a few times until it was stable.  Good basic picture/set for the money though.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: This TV is great. Its a tad bit small for viewing past 6 feet, but it would function great as a monitor with internet connectivity and a great picture. I plan to wall mount it and use it as a monitor.

Reviews.Title: Fine for it's size and price.
Reviews.Author: James Stevens "hobbies15"
Reviews.Content: Most of the reviews here have been pretty accurate. I bought this several months back to be used as a television in the spare bedroom, but ended up pressing it into service as a computer monitor a while later.On the positive side, the picture is fine and setup (including WiFi) was a breeze.The negatives, which really amount to minor annoyances:The Netflix app is slower than the one on the Roku or an LG BD player.Yes, the television speaker is crap. Would you really expect anything else in a TV this size though? There's not a television in my house that gets it's sound from the speaker installed in the television. Why should this one be any different?Channel changes are annoyingly slow. This isn't a channel surfer's box.My biggest complaint comes from it's use as a monitor. It takes forever (forever being a few seconds) to wake up the monitor. I have a two monitor setup, and a shake of the mouse or a tap on a key light's up the other monitor (a real monitor, not a TV) instantly. The Vizio takes much longer and has to display it's pretty little "V" chevron logo for a few seconds before letting me see the computer's image. I haven't tested it, but I have a feeling this may be the television connecting to the network. It may well be that disabling it's internet connection may fix this...but then it takes away one of my favorite uses for the television.

Reviews.Title: Sent Back First One
Reviews.Author: shopper "kittyowner"
Reviews.Content: The first one I ordered was defective, but Amazon did a fabulous job dealing with the replacement.  I received the next day after calling them.  The TV is fine for the bedroom and I specifically got it to stream movies.  The sound is a little tinny, but considering it is small and inexpensive, I can live with it.

Reviews.Title: Great little TV
Reviews.Author: Josh
Reviews.Content: I got this TV as a gift a few months ago and so far, it's been great. Easy to set up. Easy to use. Great features. Love it!

Reviews.Title: I loved this little wonderful TV
Reviews.Author: S. Emdadi "deal finder"
Reviews.Content: I really liked it unfortunatly have not had chance to use all its functions but I love it since I purchased it about a month ago I love it and really enjoy its wonderful performance.I shold say it was little hard at first to figure ou what bottons are for what for example took me a little while to figure out how t set up Sleep function but then that could be my issue not the system.

Reviews.Title: Stay away from any Vizio TV
Reviews.Author: Matrixunloaded
Reviews.Content: Stay away from this product and anything other offered by Vizio.First of all, Vizio does not appear to be the actual manufacturer. Instead they seem to buy products from no name Chinese companies and market them under their own name.The product in question was bought from Walmart for $229 (with free shipping) in 12/10.While wireless Internet access was sluggish in initial connection, it did actually work.Then, after approximately 18 months, Internet wireless access ceased to function, despite diagnostic tests built into the unit, which indicated it was working properly.My only experience is with this particular unit, not with the larger units that you will find in the big box stores or online, but given my experience with this unit I will stick to a name brand for large units. All our flat screen TVs have been Samsung, and I see that Sharp seems to be getting some rave reviews recently (since Samsung seems to keep their pricing model high).What I can tell you is that I will not be buying any Vizio TV in the future.The Vizio comes with a one-year warranty. All my other big-screen TVs are many years old and have had no problems.The cost to repair this $229 item out of warranty (i.e., after one year) from the outsourced repair facility in Boca Raton, Florida, recommended by Vizio was a $40 inspection fee plus $110 repair, plus one-way shipping (which considering packing materials and shipping costs would equal another $40). Adding that altogether ($190) my potential savings for having the defective unit repaired even though over a year and a half old was $39 even after the grief of going through the process. For less than half this amount I can buy a Roku, hook it up and accomplish the same thing.My review is to caution anyone thinking about buying a Vizio unit is that you are buying something not manufactured from the company selling it to you.  Given my quick Google search "Vizio sucks," it appears that there are hundreds of others with problems far more serious than my own because they bought Vizio's larger flat screen TVs.My advice - stay with a name brand such as Samsung or Sharp (or Sony if you want to overpay!).Otherwise, if you look at a 22-inch TV as "disposable" over a short life span, and also get a "deal," then amortize the cost and go ahead and buy it.To me the pain of diagnosing the problem was not worth the effort.Plus just having the broadcast channels is useless!

Reviews.Title: My first TV
Reviews.Author: Anwar
Reviews.Content: Alright, the tv was good for its price, I bought speakers with it as I read a lot of the reviews that recommended getting speakers for this tv. The tv is by VIZIO so is reliable in that sense. The only thing that really bothered me is not having batteries come with it. Without the remote, the TV can't really be set up. Thus I was really disappointed. Otherwise, it was a great purchase and came in a timely manner.

Reviews.Title: Anyone else losing closed captions on this TV?
Reviews.Author: Greyfox "Avid Reader"
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV from Amazon in December 2010 and for the last three or four months I have had problems with the closed captioning on some channels. The captioning will be working fine, but then will disappear. The only way I have found to correct this is to hit the mute or volume control every time it happens...then I have to back up to see what I have missed.I have contacted both Vizio and my provider and they both claim it's not their fault. It certainly isn't my fault.Unless Vizio accepts responsibility for this fault and provides a correction for it, I wouldn't recommend that anyone who needs captioning buy the product.

Reviews.Title: The kids love them.
Reviews.Author: rtg74
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these for my kid's bedrooms as I wanted a small HDTV with Netflix functionality. So far they have lived up to my expectations for a small HDTV at this price. The small footprint works perfect for our needs and it is lightweight enough to move without much effort. Wifi coverage in their rooms is spotty, so I was happy to see there is an Ethernet option. It seems to take a bit longer than normal for the TV to get to a picture, I would imagine this is due to the apps firmware needing to start before a picture is displayed. The remote serves its purpose. The sound is a bit tinny, so I needed to make some adjustments in the settings and while still not perfect it is better than it was out of the box. Most of the VIA apps are OK, although they don't match Google TV or Apple TV functionality. I hope a DNLA/Media Browser app is released as that would make the TV that much better.Pros: above average picture, ethernet or wifi optionCons: below average sound, slow boot up, no DLNA

Reviews.Title: Best TV Ever!
Reviews.Content: If you want a smaller TV, like for your kitchen (that's where I put mine), the Vizio M221NV 22-inch Full HD 1080P LED SCD TV with VIA Internet Application is for you. The picture is fantastic! Set up was a snap with the built-in set up Wizard. The unit has wireless Internet build in, which is good. I just got Verizon FiOS which included a wireless router for free. And it was easy to connect the Vizio TV to it. So, now I can download video on-demand stuff. I highly recommend Glee Season 1, episode #13 "Sectionals". It first aired on December 9, 2009 and had 8.13 million viewers in the U.S. At the last minute, Rachel is chosen to sing a ballad and gives a solo performance of "Don't Rain On My Parade", receiving a standing ovation after finishing. It's really good, and even better than the Streisand original, IMO. Plus, I can check in on Facebook while watching TV. So, if you want the best TV, with the most up-to-date technology, check out this Visio. You won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: Great product great merchant
Reviews.Author: dan jide
Reviews.Content: The TV/DVD combo arrived very quickly and I have been delighted with it ever since.  The price is excellent and i will definitely by products from amazon in the future

Reviews.Title: Pleased
Reviews.Author: Gemma
Reviews.Content: The TV is great.  I have no problems with the TV itself and would probably do this again.  The only problem I had was it came withthe wrong connector so I was unable to connect to the box.  They gavea $20 credit but that really didn't negate the inconvenience.On the whole the experience was a good one which enabled a good savings, so, I would purchase this way again as the TV was reallybrand new.

Reviews.Title: Netflix connectivity
Reviews.Author: Seh
Reviews.Content: I could not set up this for Netflix without wireless.  I called customer service for help and they were useless.  In the end, I had to get a friend to sign onto Netflix as me, then enter the tv code while I was connected.  The documentation from Vizio was bad, never telling how to hook up to internet or Netflix, and they did not help me at all on the phone.  Do not try to use a splitter for this, as apparently they do not work.  I was tempted to return this tv, as I bought it especially for the Netflix connection.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed but maybe jumped the gun
Reviews.Author: Trio Canine "video junkie"
Reviews.Content: I couldn't set this up smoothly and sent it back immediately. Kudos to Amazon for both fast delivery and painless return,though. I have owned numerous LCDs and know the initial start-up drill pretty well. This Vizio, though, gave me problems trying to type/label inputs, plus correct entries. I couldn't find any manual or other guidance on how to do this with the remote. The biggest problem I had, however, was loading channels onto the TV. I wanted to use cable right out of the wall rather than a box since this would only be a secondary TV and NetFlix option. I also can get HD stations for all of the major networks right from the wall. Unfortunately, the tuner couldn't pick up those channels; it only could load about 20 pretty average-to-lousy looking analog channels.I already have a Samsung hybrid monitor that picks all the channels; so the Vizio wasn't going to be worth keeping.With a cable box and a little more patience than I had, this TV could be a good solution for someone.

Reviews.Title: Excellent picture, inadequate sound
Reviews.Author: Curtis G
Reviews.Content: It was finally time to replace the bulbous 27" dinosaur in the bedroom. The original plan was to move the Panasonic TC-L32X2 32-Inch 720p LCD HDTV with iPod Dock to the bedroom and put a 42" TV in the living room, but my wife thought a smaller TV might suffice. Turns out that 22" is too small (our viewing distance is about 10 feet in a 12x12 room). That said, there's a lot to like about this TV.What I like: Price, easy connection to my home wireless network, headphone jack (I like using wireless headphones), an amazingly clear picture (I found myself watching movies I wouldn't otherwise have watched, simply because I couldn't tear myself away from the stunning visuals), 1080p, and Internet widgets. (Being able to watch Netflix streaming movies without an extra box is pretty cool.)What I don't like: Size, preset picture modes are either too dark or wildly inaccurate (I would run Digital Video Essentials: HD Basics [Blu-ray] if I were to keep it), and the big one: the speakers are terrible. The sound is incredibly tinny and there is no audio adjustment to add bass or reduce treble that I could find.This might be the right unit for a kitchen or an RV, but not for our bedroom. Back to the original plan.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't work with NJ Cablevision
Reviews.Author: Jennifer A Little
Reviews.Content: I have 2 Vizio TV's at work, which we lug around on school busses and generally abuse.  For a cheap, low-end TV, they are great.  They take a lickin' and keep on tickin'  HOWEVER, for the software necessary with a "smart" TV, it is worth spending the extra money for a better device.  This TV doesn't work with NJ Cablevision.  We bought two.  Neither worked with our router and modem.  (Not even when hooked up directly via ethernet.)  We had Cablevision out to work on them.  No go.  We purchased a new $150 Netgear Router.  No go.  We called Vizio - who informed us that their TV's don't work well with Netgear OR Linksys (the two most popular routers available).  We finally through in the towel and returned the TV's.  We went with LG's and have been VERY happy.  We tried the Sony, and although they worked fine with our router and Cablevision, we liked the apps better with LG.  Just a personal preference I guess.  I can't speak to the apps on the Vizio because we never saw them.  Sometimes you need to spend a little more to get a truly "smart" TV.  These just aren't ready yet for primetime.

Reviews.Title: It serves it's purpose
Reviews.Author: A. Hammond
Reviews.Content: My husband had been begging for a tv to go in the bathroom. I saw many problems with this, but he insisted that it would be a great thing. When his birthday came around I was at a loss as to what to get him. Then I found this tv. I bought it from amazon on sale. I was interested in it because I could use it without a cable box, antennae, or DVD player.... all things I would not want in my bathroom. I am sick of cords every where so to find a tv that can function with just one was great. The husband was ecstatic. We set it up painlessly that night and watched some videos from the amazon prime service. The screen tilts up or down to make viewing easier.I love the apps being easy to navigate through. Everything runs smoothly without the hesitation I was expecting. I was pleased with the picture quality, but the sound is as others have described. I'm not one to spend a lot on electronics so my tvs are all very low budget, but I have never had one sound this bad. If this tv were to be in a location where it was going to be used a lot I dont think I would be as happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Third Party Sellers
Reviews.Author: Mingus
Reviews.Content: Vizio makes a great tv.  The internet app is great to have and is well-worth a little extra money.  It's especially easy to connect if you already have a wireless network.Problem?  Oh yeah.Third party sellers.  This particular tv is available at locations such as Sam's Club for about forty-fifty dollars less.  They also offer free shipping.  Another thing offered by legitimate retailers is a warranty.  If you have a problem with your tv, you can easily take it back to Sam's Club, or wherever you bought it, and you will be given an immediate exchange or refund.  No hassles.  Want to return an electronic device to an Amazon third party seller?  Hmmm....Well, good luck.  First of all, you're going to be boxing it up and shipping it back (at your expense).  That is, provided that they will accept a return at all.  Then you can wait several weeks for them to get it in the mail, send it back to where they bought it (Walmart, Sam's, etc) and then get a new one shipped to you.Amazon is great about returns.  They are a legitimate retailer.  Jim Jolly's Part Time Gig, or Bobby Joe's Basement Business, are not legitimate retailers.
